finding: The SNP rs10905649 was designated as a causal SNP in the GWAS simulation, showing an effect size of β=0.02.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The sentinel variant rs2297038 had a single putative causal variant associated with short-term varenicline effectiveness (SVE) and was identified in earlier analyses as having implications in gene functions potentially relevant to varenicline response.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: This SNP was in linkage with a 446 bp deletion affecting exon 2 of ARMS2 (R2=0.24). The relationship illustrates how alterations in genes associated with Alzheimer's could influence disease mechanisms.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: Linked with a rare 12.7 Kb deletion in ADD3, found exclusively in 11 AD cases. This suggested a distinct genetic risk element for Alzheimer's that had not been identified in previous GWAS, emphasizing the role of rare variants.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The AD risk increasing allele, rs6586028_T (TSPAN14), was associated with increasingly lower CSF Aβ over time in the PD group, illustrating the differential impact of genetic factors on biomarker levels depending on disease context.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The intronic SNP rs12571421 in the CYP2C19 gene on chromosome 10 was associated with a higher risk of HTPR in the LAI adjusted GWAS, demonstrated by an odds ratio of 2.06 and a p-value of 8.37×10^-7. This SNP's significance highlights the genetic variability influencing clopidogrel treatment responses.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: The SNP rs11187838 was implicated in the shared genetic architecture between head BMD and IA, with evidence for colocalization suggesting causal variants may exist.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The rs6586028_T variant was associated with increasingly lower CSF Aβ levels over time specifically in the Parkinson's disease (PD) group, though not observed in the ADNI-Dementia and healthy control groups.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with ANC as well, with a beta coefficient of 0.330 (p=0.039). The minor allele was associated with an increase in ANC of 330 cells/mm3, indicating that this genetic variant might also have a positive effect on maintaining neutrophil levels.
title: Clozapine metabolism is associated with Absolute Neutrophil Count in individuals with treatment-resistant schizophrenia

finding: Another significant finding in the <italic>KLK3</italic> gene at 10q26.12, this SNP displayed <italic>P</italic>=8.2 10<sup>−118</sup>, contributing significantly to the overall understanding of PSA levels.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP in the <italic>MSMB</italic> gene at 10q11.23 showed significance with <italic>P</italic>=7.3 10<sup>−87</sup>, enhancing its relevance in prostate cancer screening.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was significant in <italic>FGFR2</italic> demonstrating its role in prostate health evaluations.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Related to <italic>WDR11</italic>, this variant had notable association strength with PSA measurements.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Associated with BFP in females, showcasing the need for sex-stratified analysis in understanding these genetic associations.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: An intergenic SNP that impacted expression quantitative traits in nearby genes and highlighted associations relevant to adiposity and metabolic health.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs12777332, associated with CASP7 and NRAP, demonstrated a replication of association with the risk of cataract in women, confirming prior research by Choquet et al. (2021).
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The finding for rs11191560 related to the gene NT5C2 indicated its involvement in body mass index (BMI) associations. This SNP was highlighted as part of the 115 variants linked to NT5C2 in the framework of obesity risk loci.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: This SNP was studied for its impact on miRNA binding efficiency in NT5C2, linking it to functional roles in BMI. Its association with metabolic phenotypes was demonstrated, enhancing our understanding of obesity mechanisms.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs2636809 was identified in ASD patients linked to SLIT1, providing further evidence in the exploration of the axon guidance network crucial for ASD pathology.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The research revealed that rs11314421, tied to the WBP1L gene, interacted significantly with STST for PP (P_GxE=7.8×10^-6) in female-specific analyses.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The rs111392401 variant associated with JMJD1C showed a significant interaction with LTST for DBP, achieving P_GxE=1.3×10^-8.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: This SNP was found to be connected with both hypothyroidism and TSH levels.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP showed links to reproductive health traits through its association with thyroid function.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This variant was identified as one of the three pathogenic RET variants affecting the amino acid at position 804 (V804M). It accounted for a significant portion (65%) of MEN2 cases in the AoU dataset. However, none of the carriers diagnosed with this variant presented with thyroid cancer.
title: Prevalence of the major thyroid cancer-associated syndromes in the United States

finding: This SNP met Bonferroni significance in urinary symptoms associations within a GWAS, highlighting its potential role in urinary pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: Identified near TCF7L2, a major locus for type 2 diabetes, rs7903146 was tied to CAD risk factors, establishing a link between diabetes and CAD.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs7903146 in TCF7L2 was found to be associated with T2D only in males, further emphasizing the sex differences in genetic predisposition.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: Mapped to the USP6NL gene and replicated in both the fibromyalgia cohort and Pain Questionnaire cohort, showing its association with these diseases.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The missense variant associated with BAG3 exhibited a higher risk for HFrEF (OR 1.12) but a lower risk for HFpEF (OR 0.97), indicating different risk profiles for the two heart failure subtypes.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The SNP rs150952246 on chromosome 10q22.2 was another novel finding, associated with OFCs at a p-value of 3.14e-07. This association also demonstrated its strongest effect in the combined sample.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Non-syndromic Orofacial Clefts in a Multiethnic Sample of Families and Controls Identifies Novel Regions

finding: The SNP rs118107597 at chromosome 10q24.32 revealed a novel association with a p-value of 8.21e-07, showcasing a significant connection to OFCs in the large cohort studied.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Non-syndromic Orofacial Clefts in a Multiethnic Sample of Families and Controls Identifies Novel Regions

finding: The variant rs4986893 was implicated in reduced clopidogrel metabolism. It was observed to be 50 times more prevalent in the Singaporean Chinese population than in Europeans, highlighting its clinical relevance.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The rs1799853 variant was genotyped successfully against benchmark methods with a resulting 100% concordance, establishing its clinical relevance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: Similar to rs1799853, rs1057910 was also genotyped successfully, showing a 100% concordance with benchmark assays, indicating its importance in drug response evaluations.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The rs12248560 variant was genotyped with full alignment to the benchmark results, showcasing its role in pharmacogenetic profiling.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: This SNP was associated with alanine levels specifically in the South Asian (SA) population and had not been previously linked to alanine levels before, indicating a novel association.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: Similar to rs12256633, this SNP was found to be associated with alanine levels in SAs, marking a new finding for this SNP.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: This SNP was also associated with alanine levels in the SA population and represented a novel finding in the context of metabolic traits.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: As part of the novel associations, this SNP was linked to alanine levels in SAs for the first time in this study.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: The variant rs1133400 in the INPP5A gene had a PIP of 0.93, indicating a strong association with migraine risk. It was identified as a missense variant with significant potential impact.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The SNP rs190780914 was associated with different rates of change in UPDRSII scores between SNP-carrier and non-SNP-carrier patients. This finding was linked to the gene MARK2P15, which is a pseudogene of MARK2. MARK2 has been noted as an activating kinase for PINK1, and its impairment due to loss of PINK1 function can lead to mitochondrial dysfunction, contributing to the motor symptoms of PD.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs11191116 on chromosome 10 was significantly associated with all four epilepsy phenotypes, demonstrating the strongest association among the loci identified (conjFDR = 9.14 x 10^-9). This SNP linked epilepsy risk to lower cognitive performance and reached genome-wide significance across all epilepsy phenotypes and cognitive ability. The implicated gene, KCNIP2, is involved in regulating homeostatic excitability in humans and was reported as a novel gene association related to epilepsy.
title: Unraveling the shared genetics of common epilepsies and general cognitive ability

finding: The SNP rs12777332 was associated with the risk of cataract specifically in females, replicating findings from previous studies, thus confirming its relevance in this phenotype.
title: Deep-PheWAS: a pipeline for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: At the 10q21 locus, the SNP rs10998283 demonstrated a significant association with ALL (P=3.92 x 10^-8, OR=1.15). This association signal was mainly influenced by Latino individuals.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs9415680 at the 10q21 locus showed a significant association with ALL (P=7.27 x 10^-8, OR=1.20) and was also largely driven by Latino cohorts.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: Shown to be associated with any TP53 mutation phenotype with findings across both discovery and multi-ancestry validation studies.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs75042057, falling within intron 22 of PARD3, was also identified as a genome-wide significant locus associated with impulsivity in JME, demonstrating a p-value of 3.6 × 10^-8 and explaining 9.3% of the PVE. This association was supported by previous linkage studies reported in families with idiopathic generalized epilepsy.
title: SLCO5A1 and synaptic assembly genes contribute to impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy

finding: The presence of allele B (rs1800450) was significantly associated with reduced susceptibility to leprosy, supporting its role as a protective factor (OR = 0.375, 95% CI = 0.1567-0.8977, p = 0.0387). This association was further corroborated in cases of multibacillary leprosy where the allele also conferred reduced risk (OR = 0.348, 95% CI = 0.1298-0.9704, p = 0.0441).
title: Low-MBL producing genotypes playing a role on protection to leprosy and its multibacillary forms in a highly endemic area for leprosy in Brazil

finding: This variant was in proximity to <italic>NEBL</italic>, which harbors pathogenic variants associated with primary dilated cardiomyopathy, linking it to clinical cardiac phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: This variant within <italic>BAG3</italic> gene was associated with lower left ventricular ejection fraction and linked to cardiac malfunction in multiple analyses.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The variant rs7098485 showed a nominal association with PTB through its proximal AKR1C3 gene, where the T risk allele correlated with reduced expression, possibly reducing prostaglandin availability, hinting at protective effects on PTB.
title: Genetic association study of Preterm birth and Gestational age in a population-based case-control study in Peru

finding: The SNP rs11101440 was found to be associated with endometrial cancer risk, relating to the shared genetic risk identified in the gene-based association analysis at the loci 9p21.3. This region was highlighted as significant in relation to both endometriosis and endometrial cancer, indicating a potential shared genetic basis.
title: A genetic perspective on the relationship between non-cancerous gynecological diseases and endometrial cancer

finding: The SNP rs10828247 was found at the FSHB locus and linked to endometriosis and ovarian cancer outcomes, with multiple biofeatures indicating its potential functionality.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs17149653 was found to be shared between anxiety and major depression, suggesting a common genetic influence on these disorders.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs5030889 was reported as being shared between anxiety and major depression, contributing to the understanding of comorbidity in psychiatric disorders.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs11598956 on chromosome 10 was found as another genome-wide significant locus associated with ectopic pregnancy, with a p-value of 2.41×10⁻⁸. It was located between the ASB13 and TASOR2 genes, with potential regulatory effects indicated by its associated SNP rs74599685 in the ASB13 intron.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: The rs61839660 variant was identified as a shared causal variant with a posterior probability of 100% in the colocalization analysis, linking it to reduced IL2RA gene expression and a decreased risk of type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs121965043 was identified as the likely causal variant for the association with 3-amino-2-piperidone, noting its high frequency in the Finnish population.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP was highlighted as the top contributor within the analyzed models due to its association with the INPP5F gene, a known PD risk factor that regulates intracellular signaling pathways.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: This SNP was identified as a missense variant of the WDFY4 gene located at the WDFY4 locus. It was crucial in the trans-ancestry GWAS meta-analysis, contributing significantly to the understanding of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) etiology.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The study identified a significant association of rs224081 with subconcussive cognitive impairments, specifically reflecting N400 delays and N100 amplitude reductions in athletes. These findings were noted to be replicated in male athletes and, for the first time, similar impairment patterns were observed in female athletes, indicating that this SNP could be relevant in understanding genetic predispositions to cognitive decline due to repetitive head impacts in contact sports.
title: A brain vital sign study of subconcussion in female and male high school student athletes

finding: The SNP rs1171614, which maps to another solute carrier SLC16A9, also presented evidence of a protective effect against severe Covid19. Although the specific negative outcomes linked to this SNP were not as clearly defined as with rs274567, it was part of the broader analysis indicating that variations in these SNPs had significant associations with various traits including inflammatory diseases and muscle strength.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses show that higher acetyl-carnitine and carnitine levels in blood protect against severe Covid19

finding: The tag eSNP rs11195272 was shown to affect gene expression of DUSP5 in males with a significant FDR of 0.046 post-dexamethasone. This highlights the importance of genetic variants in regulating transcriptional responses to stress specifically in male subjects.
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The SNP rs74494115 was significantly associated with the MECPP_MEHPP ratio, with an impressive effect size of -0.309 and a p-value of 1.45E-63, which is linked to the CYP2C9 gene.
title: Common genetic variants associated with urinary phthalate levels in children: a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs10997870 in the SIRT1 gene was positively associated with suicidal behaviors in individuals diagnosed with bipolar disorder, as reported in the study by Nivoli et al. (2016). This association indicates that genetic variation at this locus may confer susceptibility to suicidal behavior in this population.
title: Investigating the relationship between DNA methylation, genetic variation, and suicide attempt in bipolar disorder

finding: In the female-specific analysis, rs1219732 was implicated, showing a significant association with l-ARMSS (β_female = 0.5693, p=6.48×10-08) and l-MSSS (β_female = 0.5447, p=1.89×10-07), suggesting its potential relevance in MS severity among females.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs1329254, an intronic variant in GPR158, was newly identified in this study with a significant association to VATadjBMI (P = 1.4 x 10^-8).
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs4746140 was found to be nominally associated with the AF-related heart failure subtype, linked to the AGAP5 gene region.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: In 10p12.31, rs12246842 was associated with mean diffusivity of the fornix, showing shared genetic influences with sleep duration.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At 10q24.32, rs12411886 was related to dynamic brain morphological traits, suggesting strong genetic connections to insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Genetic analyses highlighted the role of this SNP in connection with multiple sleep index variants.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1577857 near RP11-655H13.2 indicated an association with a p-value of 2.47×10−08, reinforcing its potential role in the genetic study of alcohol consumption patterns.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: Associated with Type 2 diabetes, this variant reinforced the connections between metabolic diseases and Alzheimer’s disease progression.
title: Cross-phenotype associations between Alzheimer’s Disease and its comorbidities may provide clues to progression

finding: The SNP rs34872471 was associated with type 2 diabetes, confirmed through analyses related to the TCF7L2 gene.
title: Increasing Representativeness in the All of Us Cohort Using Inverse Probability Weighting

finding: The SNP rs35198068 was found to be associated with type 2 diabetes, indicating its relevance in diabetes susceptibility in various ancestry cohorts.
title: Increasing Representativeness in the All of Us Cohort Using Inverse Probability Weighting

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was identified as a likely risk allele for type 2 diabetes, as noted in ClinVar, highlighting its potential role as a causal variant for diabetes susceptibility.
title: Increasing Representativeness in the All of Us Cohort Using Inverse Probability Weighting

finding: The SNP was associated with the FAS gene and acted as a cis-eQTL in various tissues, highlighting its involvement in apoptosis and immune regulation.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP was located upstream of the GATA3 gene, significant for lymphocyte development and regulation.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP was located in IL2RA, associated with several autoimmune diseases and critical for T regulatory cell function.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The common missense variant rs2234962 within BAG3 demonstrated a cardioprotective function in GWAS studies related to dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), heart failure (HF), and ejection fraction, indicating its potential to maintain myofibrillar integrity and improve responses to proteotoxic stress.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The rs191757273 SNP, located in the PYROXD2 gene, interacted with LTST concerning LDL-c levels, showing a significant association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The variant rs7903146 at TCF7L2 was identified as a significant association with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in the youth group, with a joint test p-value of 1.30×10−9, and it also showed a significant effect in the marginal genetic effect test.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs35198068 at TCF7L2 was known to be associated with T2D and showed statistical significance in the adult group marginal test.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: The index SNP rs36229791 was associated with the mRNA expression levels of BLOC1S2 in squamous cell lung carcinoma (LUSC), indicating its role in oncogenic processes.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The variant rs12771445 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant association with Parkinson's disease (PD) in the Swedish cohort, with a beta estimate of -0.44 and a p-value of 1.30E-08. This association was not reported in previous cohorts, indicating potential population-specific relevance.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Another variant, rs12772937, presented a genome-wide significant association with PD (beta = -0.40, p = 2.48E-08) in the latest analyses from the imputed dataset.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The genotyped variant rs77989396 in the PLPP4 locus was associated with PD with a p-value of 2.64E-04 and an odds ratio of 0.47, indicating a reduced risk of PD associated with this variant.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Associated with PD at a Bonferroni-corrected p-value of 3.29E-04, the variant rs74466257 demonstrated a protective effect against PD, represented by an odds ratio of 0.52.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The haplotype involving rs978854 along with other variants showed significant association with PD, indicating a combined protective effect against the disease with an odds ratio of 0.69.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Much like rs978854, the rs7910507 variant was part of a haplotype inversely associated with PD, suggesting a decrease in risk with this genetic background.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Part of the significant haplotype linked to reduced PD risk, rs10886711 was included in the multi-variant analysis suggesting collective genetic factors could influence PD susceptibility.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The genetic variant rs11199417 was determined to be part of the haplotype inversely associated with PD, reinforcing the notion of protective genetic factors.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Identified in the significant haplotype linked to PD, rs10886717 further supported the hypothesis that certain genetic variants may confer decreased risk of developing PD.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Associated with novel loci for total FAs, total PUFAs, and omega-3 PUFAs; suggested as a candidate causal variant in fatty acid research.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This variant in ARID5B was linked to significant FA traits indicating its potential influence on metabolic pathways.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Located in the 3' UTR of the FAS gene, this SNP was associated with CD4+ memory stem T cells and eQTL effects in CD4+ naϊve T cells.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP was linked to enhancer regions relative to CNNM2 in the EAS population and significantly enhanced luciferase activity, indicating its role in gene regulation.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP exhibited a genome-wide significant association with PSA levels (p=8.2×10^-118), contributing to the understanding of genetic determinants influencing PSA variability.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Identified with a p-value of 7.3×10^-87, this SNP was part of the significant genetic variants related to PSA levels, further aiding in the assessment of prostate cancer risk.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP's association with PSA levels was noted with significance, contributing insightful data toward cancer genetics.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs751572082 was classified as a pathogenic variant located in Block 3 of the RET gene. The Plink analysis revealed an r² score of 0.499755 and a D' score of 1, indicating a strong linkage disequilibrium with another rare variant (10:43102014:G:C).
title: Understanding the variant landscape, and genetic epidemiology of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia in India

finding: The rs771100097 SNP corresponded to the homozygous missense mutation of the GRID1 gene (p.Arg161His) identified in affected individuals from Family A. This variant was predicted as "Disease causing" by Mutation Taster and exhibited autosomal recessive inheritance within the family, with the parents and an unaffected sibling being identified as heterozygous carriers. The variant was found in heterozygous state in 4 individuals in the gnomAD database but was not reported as homozygous.
title: GRID1/GluD1 homozygous variants linked to intellectual disability and spastic paraplegia impair mGlu1/5 receptor signaling and excitatory synapses

finding: This SNP was a significant eSNP affecting the expression of ECHDC3 in brain neurons, indicating a role in AD-related gene expression alterations.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The variant rs284585 in VEGF was associated with an increase in aortic diameter or a higher risk of thoracic aortic aneurysm and dissection (TAAD), suggesting that insulin's actions may impact angiogenesis, contributing to the risk.
title: Mendelian randomization suggests a causal link between glycemic traits and thoracic aortic structures and diseases

finding: The SNP rs7903146 in TCF7L2 was associated with inverse relationships with glucose measures such as 2-hour post-load glucose (2hPG), fasting glucose (FG), and glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c), and was also noted for its role as a diabetes candidate SNP affecting aortic phenotypes.
title: Mendelian randomization suggests a causal link between glycemic traits and thoracic aortic structures and diseases

finding: The SNP rs11200638 was identified as the lead risk variant in the ARMS2/HTRA1 risk locus for reticular pseudodrusen (RPD) associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD). This SNP reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.73e-15 and was significantly associated with RPD extent, particularly in higher risk allele dosage groups.
title: Genetic Risk of Reticular Pseudodrusen in Age-Related Macular Degeneration: HTRA1/lncRNA BX842242.1 dominates, with no evidence for Complement Cascade involvement

finding: As part of the PRP-5, this SNP exhibited a significant association with polyvascular coronary artery disease among type 2 diabetes patients, represented by an OR of 5.2 (p = 0.007).
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The finding indicated that the CYP2C9*2 allele (p.R144C; rs1799853) was associated with plasma levels of ibuprofen, with PharmGKB assigning the highest level of evidence (level 1A) to this association. This relationship was particularly relevant in populations with reduced enzyme function, emphasizing its clinical implications regarding ibuprofen dosing.
title: Exploration of interethnic variation in the ibuprofen metabolizing enzyme CYP2C9: a genetic-based cautionary guide for treatment of COVID-19 symptoms

finding: The CYP2C9*3 allele (p.I359L; rs1057910) was also found to correlate strongly with ibuprofen concentrations. As with rs1799853, this SNP was classified with level 1A evidence by PharmGKB, highlighting its significance in pharmacogenetic assessments for dosing strategies.
title: Exploration of interethnic variation in the ibuprofen metabolizing enzyme CYP2C9: a genetic-based cautionary guide for treatment of COVID-19 symptoms

finding: The lead HCM variant rs6481586 was identified during a GWAS where it exhibited effect and non-effect alleles with opposite directions of effect in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM). This finding underscored its relevance to the genetic basis of HCM.
title: Large scale genome-wide association analyses identify novel genetic loci and mechanisms in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

finding: The mannose-binding lectin 2 rs11003123 polymorphism was associated with the development of hepatocellular carcinoma in patients with hepatitis B-related cirrhosis in the Chinese population.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs61839660, associated with the IL2RA gene, showed significant results in the liability GWAS for asthma while being missed in the binary method. This result was consistent with existing literature.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: Found in super variant chr7_43 (OR=1.370, p=7.61×10−7), which suggests a role in pulmonary function and risk of COVID-19 severity.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs61843241 near NRP1 emerged as borderline significant (P = 9.06×10−8) in LV FW GWAS analysis, linking it to cardiac remodeling and potential fibrosis pathways.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The lead SNP rs1343094 was an eQTL for PLCE1, with its decreased expression correlating with increased aortic diameter and decreased strain and distensibility. This connection highlighted the role of PLCE1 in aortic function.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The SNP rs35247409 was associated with a genetic prediction of decreased NOC3L expression, correlating with an increase in aortic diameter. This locus's activity was also noted to align with CAD risk signals.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The SNP rs7921574 was discovered to be associated with a 6% increase in global brain arterial diameter and reached genome-wide significance (P=1.54×10^-8). This finding was positioned in an intron of the CNNM2 gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs10748839 showed significant association with global brain arterial diameter (P=2.54×10^-8) in the trans-ancestry GWAS analysis, marking it as a relevant variant near the NT5C2 gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs10786721 was found to significantly associate with global brain arterial diameter (P=4.97×10^-8), linked to the AS3MT gene locus.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs7897654 was associated with decreased brain arterial diameter (β=-0.06) and increased expression of CNNM2 (β=0.02), confirming a functional relationship.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The study found that the genotype CYP2C19*2 (rs4244285) was included in the clinical decision support algorithm, and the use of this SNP was associated with improved outcomes in reducing the incidence of major adverse cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events (MACCEs) among Caribbean Hispanic patients post-percutaneous coronary intervention. Specifically, patients with a high-risk score who received genotype-guided therapy exhibited superior outcomes compared to those under standard of care.
title: Implementing a Pharmacogenomic-driven Algorithm to Guide Antiplatelet Therapy among Caribbean Hispanics: A non-randomized prospective cohort study

finding: The TCF7L2 rs7903146 SNP was associated with impaired insulin secretion in mothers with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM). Specifically, carriers of the risk allele (T) exhibited significantly lower fasting insulin levels compared to non-carriers. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic factors, particularly regarding insulin secretion deficiencies, in the development of GDM.
title: Fasting C-peptide in Gestational Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The rs10736933 variant was identified as significantly associated with the total scale of social isolation, located near the ACADSB and HMX3 genes. This intergenic variant suggested a potential role in the susceptibility to social isolation, as both associated genes relate to health, with ACADSB being involved in neurometabolic disorders.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Social Isolation in 63 497 Japanese Individuals from the General Population

finding: The rs6413432 T>A polymorphism in the CYP2E1 gene significantly affected isoniazid (INH) bioavailability. Heterozygous participants showed a 23% higher bioavailability than wild type patients (p=0.0008), indicating the importance of this SNP in guiding personalized INH dosing.
title: A Nanopore sequencing-based pharmacogenomic panel to personalize tuberculosis drug dosing

finding: Nonsense variant rs41292634 in the DCLRE1A gene was significantly associated with menopause timing (p = 7.5 x 10<sup>-11</sup>), indicating a previously unrecognized role in menopause.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: Found to be significantly associated with schizophrenia in the EUR population (GWAS p-value = 6.4E-13), it highlighted the distinct genetic architecture affecting SCZ across populations.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with SCZ in the EAS population (GWAS p-value = 5.4E-12), showcasing regional genetic variations impacting the disease.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The eSNP chr10:104654577:T:C significantly enhanced luciferase activity in dual reporter assays, solidifying its role as an enhancer variant linked to CNM2.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The SNP rs73591716 was significantly associated with mid-trimester cervical length, mapping to the CACNB2 gene, which regulates calcium ion influx, an important factor in uterine activity and contraction.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Cervical Length is Shared with Spontaneous Preterm Birth Risk

finding: The SNP rs143282422 was identified as a putatively causal missense variant in the gene CDH23, which is implicated in hearing loss.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs10901863 was identified as an intronic variant in the gene CTBP2 and was prioritized in the context of causal variant inference for hearing loss.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The common missense variant C151R (rs2234962) in the BAG3 gene was associated with influencing plasma NT-proBNP and BNP levels. This variant suggested BAG3's potential cardioprotective function and was previously linked to dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), heart failure (HF), and ejection fraction.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The variant rs7090046 was found to be significantly associated with Raynaud's syndrome (RS) at the genome-wide significant level (P = 3.93×10⁻⁴⁷). This association was replicated across multiple cohorts, suggesting that adrenergic signaling through the ADRA2A locus plays a major role in the pathophysiology of RS. Furthermore, the variant was shown to co-localize with increased ADRA2A gene expression in tibial arteries, indicating its regulatory impact on vascular function.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The variant rs1343449 was shown to be the lead variant associated with ADRA2A gene expression in GTEx data, and was highly correlated with rs7090046. Its functional significance in relation to Raynaud's syndrome was supported by evidence from tissue-specific expression analyses.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNP rs12247015 was associated with TFAM, identified as a 5' UTR variant with a promotor-like signature, indicating its importance in mtDNA regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs4397793 mapped to an intronic variant in TFAM, displaying a proximal enhancer-like signature and was noted for its significant role in regulating mtDNA-CN.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs58678340, associated with TWNK/MPRL43, exhibited a strong relationship with mtDNA-CN, indicating its potential influence on mitochondrial health.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs1049432 was linked to TFAM, contributing significantly to mtDNA-CN with implications for mitochondrial function.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The intronic variant rs3934643:G>A in SFTPD was previously reported to be associated with lung function and COVID-19 severity, showing significant effects on these traits.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The variant rs12248560 (CYP2C19*17) was associated with increased metabolism of PPIs, which led to a higher risk of influenza and pneumonia among users.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The genetic variant rs17884712 (CYP2C19*9) was utilized to categorize PPI users, corresponding to alterations in PPI metabolism, thereby influencing the risk profile for respiratory infections.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The variant rs4986893 (CYP2C19*3) indicated a likelihood of decreased function in PPI metabolism, also correlating with increased risks for conditions such as severe COVID-19 and mortality among users.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The rs4244285 (CYP2C19*2) variant was part of the classification that suggested lower PPI metabolism and was associated with elevated risks for pneumonia and severe COVID-19 scenarios.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The SNP rs10740129, located near JMJD1C, was found to be associated with AF and showed associations with multiple cardiometabolic traits. This locus displayed unique effects on AF in contrast to other traits, with its involvement in lipogenesis and hormonal regulation potentially influencing AF risk independently of cardiometabolic profiles.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: Similar to rs10810632, the SNP rs1358030 was also found to have indirect associations with T1DC traits through HbA1c. The analysis indicated that this SNP had a robust indirect effect that did not include zero in its 95% bootstrap confidence intervals, reinforcing its importance in the genetic architecture of T1DC.
title: Characterization of direct and/or indirect genetic associations for multiple traits in longitudinal studies of disease progression

finding: The SNP rs281851, an intronic variant of the CCDC3 gene, was found to have a strong interaction with excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS). Individuals with the A allele of this variant experienced an increased apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) when they reported EDS, suggesting a significant genetic influence on OSA severity in the context of EDS.
title: Gene-Excessive Sleepiness Interactions Suggest Treatment Targets for Obstructive Sleep Apnea Subtype

finding: pgBoost linked rs12722502, fine-mapped for both deep vein thrombosis (PIP 0.93) and eosinophil count (PIP 0.51), to IL2RA at a distance of 11kb to the TSS. The SNP was found in an intronic enhancer of IL2RA, a key gene in the interleukin 2 signaling pathway. This link also appeared in the top 5% of predictions by the distance-based method.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: This index variant was associated with shape features in the hippocampus and linked to renal function, showcasing its genetic influence.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Associated with hippocampal and ventricular shape features, this SNP highlighted its significance in understanding cognitive impairment linked to kidney health.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The variant was associated with insomnia and could provide insight into plasticity in brain structure.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs3740066, related to the MRP2-ABCC2 genetic score in offspring, demonstrated an interaction effect with prenatal antiseizure medication use that was linked to lower birth weight. Specifically, there was a birth weight difference of 70.3 grams in the lowest genetic score category (2 risk alleles) and -306 grams in the highest category (6 risk alleles), with an interaction p-value of 0.019.
title: Interaction between placental efflux transporters and use of antiseizure or antidepressant drugs during pregnancy on birth weight in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs746298, linked to LINC00841/C10orf142, was found to be significantly associated with low T1D PRS, illustrating its potential role in type 1 diabetes etiology.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs1171614 was identified as the lead SNP for a co-localized cis-eQTL for SLC16A9, which encodes a kidney monocarboxylate transporter involved in carnitine transport.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: This SNP is a trans-eQTL of rs1171614 at the CUBN locus, indicating a regulatory link between these genes.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The rs114026383 variant at the LRMDA locus was significantly associated with Covid-19 susceptibility among non-Europeans, suggesting increased risk in individuals of African ancestry (OR = 2.39).
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The SNP rs10795668 located on 10p14 was associated with CRC, displaying an OR of 1.19 (95% CI: 1.015-1.393, P=0.03216), reinforcing findings from prior studies.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The SNP rs10795616 demonstrated the strongest association with health satisfaction (p = 2.21e-08) among the analyzed loci. While it was one of the lead SNPs from the 8 novel loci identified, it primarily related to health satisfaction rather than the other somatoform traits, suggesting potential specificity in its association.
title: Multivariate, Multi-omic Analysis in 799,429 Individuals Identifies 134 Loci Associated with Somatoform Traits

finding: This SNP was linked to mild progression subtype (Subtype I), indicating a potential protective genetic factor against rapid symptom development.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was linked to mild progression subtype (Subtype I), further elucidating the genetic landscape of slow-progressing Parkinson's disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was found to increase the risk of T2D with an odds ratio of 1.65, suggesting a significant association with T2D risk.
title: Rare variants of the glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor (GLP1R) gene are overrepresented in a severe obesity cohort and associated with type 2 diabetes in the UK Biobank

finding: Similarly, this variant had an odds ratio of 1.39, indicating its association with increased T2D risk as well.
title: Rare variants of the glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor (GLP1R) gene are overrepresented in a severe obesity cohort and associated with type 2 diabetes in the UK Biobank

finding: The missense variant rs721917:A>G (p.Met31Thr) in SFTPD was associated with an increased risk for hospitalization due to COVID-19 (OR = 1.06, P = 1.7 × 10^-8), and it was earlier linked to chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and decreased lung function.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: This intronic SNP to MLLT10 was shared across substantial clusters for PCOS, endometriosis, and UF, indicating its relevance in those reproductive conditions.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The T allele of rs2002042 from ABCC2 gene was shown to be less frequent in LLIs, correlating to a 0.486 times diminished chance of surviving beyond age 85, which relates to healthier liver and biliary functions.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: This common variant in <italic>TSPAN14</italic> exhibited a significant replication in this cohort and was recently associated with late-onset AD, supporting its relevance in AAO.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The SNP rs3740129 was linked to variations in DNA methylation levels at CpGs within the 3'UTR of CHST3. Analysis revealed that the effect allele A was associated with decreased methylation, supporting its role as an OA risk locus. These findings indicated the significance of this SNP in the context of knee OA via epigenetic mechanisms.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: The SNP rs11599750 was associated with GCA risk as evidenced by the PheWAS, leading to a statistically significant causal effect on GCA risk. This association was in the same direction as the variant's direct association with GCA.
title: Exploration of the circulating human secretome through protein quantitative trait analysis identifies an association between circulating levels of apolipoprotein L1 and risk of giant cell arteritis

finding: The SNP rs793102 was found to be significantly associated with a causal link between Graves' disease (GD) and an increased risk of Type 2 diabetes (T2D) after sensitivity analyses. The odds ratio (OR) suggested a slight increase in risk, indicating its relevance in the pathway connecting GD to T2D.
title: The causal relationship between Graves’ disease and type 2 diabetes: Evidence from Bidirectional Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Known to be enriched among patients with dilated cardiomyopathy, linking this SNP to a specific heart failure phenotype.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP tagged BAG3 mutation which is prominent in dilated cardiomyopathy, providing insights into genetic predispositions for HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The study found that the SNP rs224081 was significantly associated with the cognitive impairments observed in athletes after repetitive head impacts. This association was particularly noted in the context of N400 delays and N100 amplitude reductions, which reflected cognitive and sensory processing deficits. Additionally, evidence suggested that female athletes exhibited a stronger response in relation to this SNP compared to male athletes, indicating a potential genetic predisposition to greater susceptibility to subconcussive impairments.
title: An objective neurophysiological study of subconcussion in female and male high school student athletes

finding: This SNP was included as one of the putative causal variants identified in the adiponectin analysis.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was also nominated as a putative causal variant for adiponectin association.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The rs7076938 variant in ADRB1 improved freedom from rehospitalization or death in individuals with atrial fibrillation (HR 0.92, P=0.001). It also indicated an increased risk of cardiovascular death or heart transplant for TT genotype carriers in unmatched (HR 1.01, P=0.0043) and matched (HR 1.081, P=0.0012) participants.
title: Combining Genetic Proxies of Drug Targets and Time-to-event analyses From Longitudinal Observational Data To Identify Target Patient Populations

finding: The rs2234962 variant in BAG3 showed a decreased risk of heart failure rehospitalization or cardiovascular death/transplant within 10 years in heart failure patients (HR 0.96, P=0.033).
title: Combining Genetic Proxies of Drug Targets and Time-to-event analyses From Longitudinal Observational Data To Identify Target Patient Populations

finding: The study investigated the effect of the CYP2C9 rs2860905 polymorphism on the efficacy of losartan in Pakistani hypertensive patients. The findings suggested that this SNP may influence the response to losartan treatment, providing insights into how individual genetic variations can affect drug efficacy.
title: Impact of Losartan on Portal hypertension and Liver Cirrhosis: A Systematic Review

finding: The protein-altering variant rs7080536 in the HABP2 gene was associated with reduced protein activity and significant associations with carotid stenosis and venous thromboembolism.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The variant rs2270552 showed significant colocalization with expression signals for various genes, including infections of ADK and lncRNA in blood and heart tissues.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The SNP rs7921574 was associated with a 6% increase in global brain arterial diameter (β = 0.06, P = 1.54×10^-8). This was the top SNP associated with this trait, located in an intron of the CNNM2 gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs10748839 was associated with global brain arterial diameter, with a genome-wide significance level (P = 2.54×10^-8). It was located near the NT5C2 gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs10786721 was found to associate with global brain arterial diameter, achieving genome-wide significance (P = 4.97×10^-8), and is located in the AS3MT gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: SNP rs7897654 was linked to decreased brain arterial diameter (β = -0.06) and increased expression of the CNNM2 gene (β = 0.02). This finding indicated a functional relationship with brain arterial diameter.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs603424, located near SCD, was connected to higher monounsaturated fatty acid (MUFA) biosynthesis and was associated with lower odds of coronary artery disease among individuals of European ancestry.
title: The impact of fatty acids biosynthesis on the risk of cardiovascular diseases in Europeans and East Asians: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: It was identified as a significant association near genes MRC1 and TMEM236 on chromosome 10, related to reduced hypothyroidism risk with an odds ratio of 0.94 (p-value = 2.6e-11).
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The T2D-protective C allele near ZMIZ1 was linked to increased levels of active GLP-1, with a significant p-value of 1.6x10^-5, contributing insights into T2D pathophysiology.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The T risk allele was associated with higher active GLP-1 levels, providing further support for its role in modulating T2D risk through incretin physiology.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The SNP at PTEN locus contributed to decreased expression of telomerase, thereby influencing LTL through regulatory pathways important in telomere biology.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: This SNP was significant only in African ancestry and linked to telomere maintenance, with effects consistent across various studies analyzing genetic ancestry impact on LTL.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP rs7090046 was linked to the gene ADRA2A, where higher expressions in the tibial artery were associated with increased risk of Raynaud's phenomenon (RP). With an odds ratio (OR) of 1.27, it was identified as a candidate causal variant for RP, representing the first robust genetic evidence for its contribution.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies ADRA2A and IRX1 as novel risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The variant rs1343449 was identified as a cis-eQTL for ADRA2A in artery tissue and was included in the credible set of variants linked to rs7090046. This connection boosted confidence in the role of ADRA2A in RP.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies ADRA2A and IRX1 as novel risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The top SNP identified from the multivariate analysis, rs11245366, was associated with the gene EEF1AKMT2. It was found to have associations with cystatin C, creatine, and urate levels, which are related to kidney function. The findings suggest a genetic relationship between the volumes of the CC and kidney dysfunction phenotypes, indicating a shared genetic etiology worth further investigation.
title: Distributed Genetic Effects of the Corpus Callosum Subregions Suggest Links to Neuropsychiatric Disorders and Related Traits

finding: The variant rs12771445 in the PLPP4 locus was identified as a novel genome-wide significant association with Parkinson's disease (PD) in this Swedish cohort, with a beta of -0.44, SE of 0.07, and p-value of 1.30E-08. This association had not been reported in other cohorts, suggesting it may be specific to the Swedish population.
title: Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The variant rs12772937 at chr10:122318146 had a genome-wide significant association with PD, showing a beta of -0.40 and p-value of 2.48E-08, similar to rs12771445.
title: Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: It was noted as a highly significant coding missense variant associated with NAFLD.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs2342606 tagged the deletion of <italic>LOC642521/LOC642538</italic> and was associated with an HR of 1.373 for AR time. It was also found to be linked with increased expression of the TMEM254 antisense RNA in various tissues.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: This SNP, located in BAG3, was associated with a missense variant resulting in a significant amino acid change, indicating its relationship to cardiac contractility and mitral valve dimensions.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: This missense variant in BAG3 was directly linked to contractility and thus impacted the dimensions of the mitral valve annulus.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The SNP rs146777408 in CFAP46 was nominally significant (p=3.34×10^-7) in the suggestive associations observed.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs7090046 was associated with an increased risk of Raynaud's phenomenon (RP), with an odds ratio (OR) per allele of 1.26, indicating a significant genetic contribution to RP risk. This variant was identified as one of the lead variants in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) that emphasized its relationship with the alpha2A-adrenoreceptor signaling pathway.
title: ADRA2A and IRX1 are putative risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The SNP rs1343449 was part of a credible set that indicated a strong colocalization with ADRA2A gene expression in artery tissue. This variant served as a cis-eQTL for ADRA2A and shared a genetic signal with RP, reinforcing its role in the pathology of Raynaud's phenomenon.
title: ADRA2A and IRX1 are putative risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The SNP rs4918722 was identified in the intronic region of the GPAM gene, which encodes an enzyme critical for phospholipid biosynthesis and triglyceride synthesis. Studies showed that rats with overexpression of GPAM developed steatosis and hepatic insulin resistance despite a normal diet.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs182977703 was associated with COM_Norm and CDICT_Total and was found within the gene SHTN1 (Shootin 1). This gene plays a crucial role in neuronal polarity, and defects in it may lead to neurodevelopmental disorders such as intellectual disability.
title: A genome-wide association study of Chinese and English language abilities in Hong Kong Chinese children

finding: Rs7903146 was highlighted in both European and African American credible sets, recognized as having the highest posterior probability in the European analysis concerning its causal role at the TCF7L2 locus.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant association with constitutive PSA variability and was among the strongest associations identified in the study.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP, located within the MSMB gene, was found to be significantly linked to PSA levels and prostate cancer risk.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was shown to have associations with PSA levels among the African ancestry analysis.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs78656993 was identified within the NRP1 gene and located in an enhancer region, indicating its potential regulatory role.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs1411924, located at a transcriptional factor binding site within the NRP1 gene, was identified as an additional signal.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs2234962 was found as a coding variant in the BAG3 gene, associated with known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs6480922, located in the ZMIZ1 gene, was identified as having a genome-wide significant association with p-S65-Ub levels, showing a negative association (β: -0.33, p=1.42x10^-8). This indicates that higher levels of this variant were associated with lower p-S65-Ub levels, suggesting a role in mitigating mitochondrial damage in LBD.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies APOE and ZMIZ1 variants as mitophagy modifiers in Lewy body disease

finding: As a proxy SNP utilized in the analysis, it contributed to establishing a strong association with usual walking pace, suggesting a protective effect against migraine.
title: Potential Causal Relationship between Faster Walking Pace and Reduced Migraine Risk: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: This SNP was employed as a proxy and supported the association with walking pace, indirectly indicating a decreased risk of migraine.
title: Potential Causal Relationship between Faster Walking Pace and Reduced Migraine Risk: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: At the VDAC2 locus (rs7088974), a significant genetic association was identified with both PAD and CAD (bivariate P=7.8×10^-9). This signal colocalized with VDAC2 mRNA expression in critical vascular tissues, including the aorta and tibial artery, suggesting a relationship between this variant and increased expression of VDAC2, which is linked to atherosclerosis progression.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The SORCS3 locus (rs11599236) displayed a nominal genome-wide significant signal with PAD and total cholesterol (bivariate P=2.4×10^-8). This SNP was previously linked to mood disorders and demonstrated a consistent direction of effect with increased SORCS3 expression correlating with higher PAD and cholesterol levels.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The variant rs182341709 in LINC02661 showed a majority classification of cases as mild AD, suggesting a weaker association with disease severity.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The SNP rs7900976, an intron variant in GAD2, demonstrated significant association as well. It was noted that GAD2 expression was upregulated over time for major allele homozygotes and downregulated for heterozygous individuals, with insufficient data to establish trends for homozygous minor individuals. These patterns in GAD2 expression were implicated in the vulnerability to depression.
title: Sensitive period-regulating genetic pathways and exposure to adversity shape risk for depression

finding: The SNP was previously shown to be associated with 'Hirschsprung's disease'. In the PheWAS using Peds-Phecodes, it captured a significant association with phecode 750.214 'Hirschsprung's disease and other congenital functional disorders of colon' (OR = 2.23, p = 6.02 x 10^-4), while the PheWAS using the standard phecodes did not replicate the association accurately.
title: Developing and Evaluating Pediatric Phecodes (Peds-Phecodes) for High-Throughput Phenotyping Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The locus rs773949 located on chromosome 10 was identified as significantly associated with anorexia nervosa (AN) and was one of the loci overlapping between AN and body mass index (BMI). This suggested a potential shared biological mechanism influencing both traits.
title: An Evolutionary Perspective on the Genetics of Anorexia Nervosa

finding: This SNP was identified in the study as being significantly associated with Raynaud's syndrome at the *ADRA2A* locus (P = 3.93×10^-47). The research indicated that this SNP influenced *ADRA2A* gene expression in a tissue-specific manner in distal arteries, implicating adrenergic signaling as a significant risk factor for the condition.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: This variant was noted for its eQTL significance related to *ADRA2A* in tibial arteries, co-localizing with the Raynaud's syndrome genetic signal and supporting the finding that higher expression of *ADRA2A* is connected to increased risk for the syndrome.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNP rs11200634, linked to the ARMS2 gene, was associated with the risk of age-related macular degeneration, showing a beta of 0.05 and a p-value of 2.26×10^-10. This association illustrated how specific genetic variants could inform about risks related to eye health and conditions.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: The MORC4 locus (lead SNP rs12764049) associated with strontium levels was investigated.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The BORCS7-ASMT locus (lead SNP rs10883790) was known to be associated with 17-hydroxyprogesterone levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP2C18 locus (lead SNP rs1926711) suggested an association with 11-Deoxycorticosterone.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The EGR2-NRBF2 locus (lead SNP rs10822140) participated in endocrine disruptions.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The JMJD1C locus (lead SNP rs6479891) provided insights into hormone metabolic pathways.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The rs114598725 variant was linked to POAG risk in males and classified under a male-specific novel locus, indicating additional complexity in risk structure.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs11190559 variant emerged as significant in connection with TWAS analyses revealing associations across different tissues with implications for several neoplastic disorders.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs4244285 corresponded to the CYP2C19*2 no function allele, which was found to be twice as common in individuals of Asian ancestry compared to those of European ancestry. This difference raised ethical and legal implications regarding testing prioritization for pharmacogenetic profiling.
title: Evaluating the frequency and the impact of pharmacogenetic alleles in an ancestrally diverse Biobank population

finding: The noncoding variant rs12248560 was crucial for identifying the CYP2C19*17 increased function allele. The presence of this allele in conjunction with a normal function allele indicated the 'Rapid Metabolizer' (RM) phenotype, while two *17 alleles suggested an 'Ultra Rapid Metabolizer' (UM) phenotype. These phenotypes were integral in determining appropriate drug dosing and treatment strategies.
title: Evaluating the frequency and the impact of pharmacogenetic alleles in an ancestrally diverse Biobank population

finding: Homozygosity for the rs7897633 A allele in the PRKG1 gene was a significant risk factor for increased COVID-19 mortality in European-American subjects, particularly notable in younger patients without protective biomarkers.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: Exhibited sex-dependent opposing effects on Aβ pathology, being negatively influential in males and positively influential in females.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The variant rs111336312, located in the <italic>BMPR1A</italic> gene, was identified as a candidate influencing right ventricular ejection fraction (RVEF) uniquely in women.
title: Sex-specific genetic determinants of right ventricular structure and function

finding: The variant rs140745739, situated within the promoter of <italic>BMPR1A</italic>, was significantly associated with cardiac index in female patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH), indicating its role as a determinant of RV function.
title: Sex-specific genetic determinants of right ventricular structure and function

finding: The SNP rs12415800 showed a significant association with major depression, exhibiting a prevalence of 45% in the Chinese population compared to only 2% in European populations.
title: Similarity and diversity of genetic architecture for complex traits between East Asian and European populations

finding: The SNP rs35936514 was also associated with major depression, being more common in the Chinese population at 28% versus 6% in European populations.
title: Similarity and diversity of genetic architecture for complex traits between East Asian and European populations

finding: As the most significant association with descending aortic distensibility, this intronic variant in PLCE1 was confirmed as a strong eQTL in arterial tissue.
