title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: In subtype 2, SNP rs7903146 demonstrated significant colocalization with asthma, indicated by a PPH4 of 1.0, suggesting a strong shared genetic predisposition.
title: Identification of distinct trajectories in preclinical type 2 diabetes and their associations with outcomes

finding: The SNP rs559580 was identified as the strongest common variant associated with left/co-dominance at the CXCL12 locus in a multi-ancestry cohort from the Penn Medicine Biobank. It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.18, an odds ratio (OR) of 1.46, and a p-value of 6.7x10^-5, indicating its significant role in coronary dominance.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: SNP rs1870634 was found to colocalize with the shared genetic locus for coronary dominance and coronary artery disease (CAD). It was noted as a significant shared variant within a proximal peak, reinforcing the association between genetic determinants of coronary patterning and CAD.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs7074248 was part of the significant findings associated with CXCL12 levels, and showed an increased prevalence of right dominance. This association was consistent with findings from the Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) dataset.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: At the CXCL12 dominance locus, rs115213152 was identified as the highest-ranking variant, predicted to disrupt KLF transcription factor motifs which are essential for blood vessel responses. It was also linked to alterations in chromatin accessibility in various cardiac cell types.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: SNP rs649192 was significant in colocalization analyses that identified it as part of the shared variants influencing both coronary dominance and CAD, suggesting its critical role in this genetic overlap.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs7903146 in the TCF7L2 locus showed a significant association with GDM (p=4.0×10−16). Similar to the other SNPs, it had been previously linked to T2D, indicating overlapping genetic contributions between the two diseases.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs9663238 in the HKDC1 locus was associated with GDM at genome-wide significance (p=2.9×10−8). However, it demonstrated weak association with T2D (p=0.0083), suggesting specific implications for glucose regulation during pregnancy.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs201581170 was associated with an increased risk of multiple cancers (OR=1.16, P=3.1x10^-12) and maintained this association in invasive analyses (OR=1.17, P=2.4x10^-10).
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The SNP rs9419958 was associated with increased risk of multiple invasive cancers (OR=1.16, P=1.7x10^-11) and also related to multiple cancers (OR=1.14, P=7.2x10^-12).
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The lead variant rs61871747 in the ARMS2-HTRA1 locus showed significant associations across ancestries, with odds ratios for the risk-increasing allele ranging from 2.03 to 2.92. Ancestry-specific confidence intervals excluded unity, indicating no difference in effect across European, African, and Asian ancestries.
title: Diverse ancestry GWAS for advanced age-related macular degeneration in TOPMed-imputed and Ophthalmologically-confirmed 16,108 cases and 18,038 controls

finding: The missense variant rs721917:A>G (p.Met31Thr) in SFTPD conferred risk for hospitalization, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.06 and a p-value of 1.7 x 10^-8. It was previously linked to increased risk of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and decreased lung function.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: Although this SNP had a lower imputation quality, it was included in the sensitivity analyses showing a consistent association between pancreas fat and PDAC, emphasizing its potential relevance.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: rs10828248 on chromosome 10 was identified in the genome-wide association study (GWAS) of chronic dizziness among individuals of European ancestry, with a significant p-value of 3.17 x 10^-08, indicating its potential association with the phenotype.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: Lead SNP rs12779865 was identified during trans-ancestry GWAS and was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs10828248 on chromosome 10, corroborating its association with chronic dizziness across different ancestry groups.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs2147896 was linked to the missingness of N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine and was involved in the mediation between the SNP and the corresponding metabolite's odds of missingness, highlighting its relationship with metabolic pathways related to trimethylamine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs11189559 was implicated in relation to PYROXD2 and showed significant associations with the odds of missingness of N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine, further supporting its involvement in mitochondrial function and metabolic dysregulation.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The rs150342746 polymorphism was associated with severe COVID-19, showing a suggestive odds ratio of 3.47 (95% CI = 1.81-6.68, P = 1.86×10^-4) in single-SNP association analysis.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: The rs10824845 polymorphism also showed significant association with severe COVID-19, with an odds ratio of 1.76 (95% CI = 1.30-2.39, P = 2.91×10^-4). A meta-analysis revealed a pooled odds ratio of 1.32 (95% CI = 1.15-1.52, P = 9.12×10^-5) for the same SNP.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: This polymorphism demonstrated an association with severe COVID-19, showing an odds ratio of 1.42 (95% CI = 1.17-1.73, P = 3.47×10^-4).
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: The rs10824844 polymorphism was part of a haplotype associated with severe COVID-19 with an OR of 1.88 (95% CI = 1.44-2.45, P = 1.04×10^-5) and was correlated with the rs10824845 SNP.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: This variant was significantly associated with COVID-19 susceptibility (OR = 4.11) and severity of symptoms (OR = 7.91), indicating a potential impact on splicing processes of the MBL2 gene.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: The SNP rs6586028 at the TSPAN14 locus demonstrated a significant association with Alzheimer’s disease, with a p-value of 2.33×10^-12 in stage 2 analyses, marking it as a novel association.

The region containing rs11191660 (chr10:103343208 A/G) showed a significant association with the expression level of an isoform (NM_032747.3) of the ATP5MK gene. The deletion induced in HEK293 cells demonstrated that this SNP plays a functional role in regulating isoform expression, evidenced by significantly lower gene expression levels in cells with the deletion.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals novel isoform-specific eQTLs and regulatory mechanisms of isoform expression

finding: The minor allele of rs2104286 in the IL2RA gene was associated with an increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis, as identified in the study.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs1265005 was recognized as an exonic missense variant in the COL17A1 gene, with an association to FGT polyps (P = 1.09 x 10<sup>-9</sup>). The COL17A1 gene is implicated in cellular migration and differentiation, further indicating a connection to tumorigenesis and tissue overgrowth.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: This SNP was associated with both FGT polyps and uterine fibroids, indicating its potential role in the development of endometrial issues. Additionally, associations with type 2 diabetes and waist-to-hip ratio were noted, highlighting its significance in metabolic and reproductive health.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs11200630 at the ARMS2-HTRA1 locus was significantly associated with higher RPD load, showing a genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.9e-09.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs61871744 at the ARMS2-HTRA1 locus associated with drusen was statistically significant, with a p-value of 4.2e-20, reinforcing the established relationship with AMD.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The variant rs41292624 in VTI1A displayed significant association signals in East Asians.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The intergenic variant near STN1-SLK showed positive associations connected with adenocarcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs1324319 showed associations with gastrointestinal disorders, notably IBD and obesity, which may also relate to the gastrointestinal manifestations of COVID-19.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP rs184619214 in the CCDC7 gene reached a GWAS significance level of p = 6.38 x 10^-9. This SNP was replicated in multiple cohorts and reached statistical significance in the meta-analysis stage with p = 4.47 x 10^-11, confirming its association with diabetic retinopathy (DR) in patients with type 1 diabetes. The study also estimated SNP-based heritability of DR at 31.09%.
title: Genome-wide association studies found CCDC7 and ITGB1 associated with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The SNP rs79853754 in the ITGB1 gene had a significant p-value of 3.24 x 10^-8, suggesting its role in the progression of diabetic retinopathy (DR). This finding was supported by pathway analysis indicating that ITGB1 is involved in the generation of biomolecules influencing DR progression.
title: Genome-wide association studies found CCDC7 and ITGB1 associated with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The variant rs61839660-T in the IL2RA gene was associated with an increased risk of melanoma skin cancer (MSC), with an OR of 1.11 (95% CI 1.02-1.21), making it a positive original finding.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The lead SNP rs10762653 was the second most significant novel pneumonia-associated locus found in the study, possessing a high posterior probability for being causal, thus identifying it as a positive finding in the context of pneumonia.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: The variant rs1172955 was associated with later puberty timing in girls, showing a beta of 0.04 years, with a p-value of 6.6×10^-12. It was also nominally associated with earlier age at natural menopause, with a beta of -0.04 years and a p-value of 6.6×10^-3. The presence of this variant indicated that it could influence reproductive lifespan by being linked to variations in menarche and menopause age.
title: Genetic susceptibility to earlier ovarian ageing increases de novo mutation rate in offspring

finding: This SNP was part of a novel locus on chromosome 10 identified in the GWAS. It was discussed as an intergenic variant without an associated gene, specifically relevant to the overall observed traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was connected to ZMIZ1 and implicated in total FAs, total PUFAs, and omega-3 PUFAs, suggesting it as a candidate shared causal variant.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Similar to others, this SNP was discussed as a potential causal variant at a notable locus related to fat traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was linked to the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), suggesting it may influence gradual symptom development.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: This SNP was linked to the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), indicating it may impact slower PD symptom worsening.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: The deletion mismatch tagged by rs2342606 was associated with an increased risk of AR with a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.373 (95% CI: 1.011–1.865, P-value 0.042). Furthermore, it was correlated with altered expression levels of several genes, including TMEM254 and its antisense RNA TMEM254-AS1.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The SNP rs12256633 was associated with alanine levels in the South Asian population, marking it as a novel association that had not been reported previously.
title: Genome-wide association and mendelian randomisation study of metabolites and pregnancy dysglycemia in a UK multi-ethnic birth cohort

finding: Similar to rs12256633, rs17121228 was also related to alanine levels in South Asians and represented an original finding not documented in prior studies.
title: Genome-wide association and mendelian randomisation study of metabolites and pregnancy dysglycemia in a UK multi-ethnic birth cohort

finding: The association of rs7096521 with alanine levels in South Asians was an original discovery made during this study.
title: Genome-wide association and mendelian randomisation study of metabolites and pregnancy dysglycemia in a UK multi-ethnic birth cohort

finding: As with the other alanine-associated SNPs, rs12240368 was identified for the first time in relation to alanine levels in the South Asian demographic.
title: Genome-wide association and mendelian randomisation study of metabolites and pregnancy dysglycemia in a UK multi-ethnic birth cohort

finding: This SNP was involved in super-variants associated with genes that may enhance susceptibility to severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: This variant attained 100% concordance with benchmark assays, playing a critical role in CYP2C9 associated drug metabolism.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: Similar to rs1799853, rs1057910 achieved a genotype concordance rate of 100% against benchmarks, which is significant in understanding P450 enzyme activity.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: This SNP was genotyped successfully with 100% concordance against the Agena VeriDose Core platform, implying reliable assay performance for CYP2C19 metabolic variations.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The SNP rs10490924 corresponding to ARMS2 A69S was associated with increased risk for both geographic atrophy and neovascular disease in AMD pathology.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: SNP rs2399971 was significantly associated with HBsAg seroclearance in patients who had received antiviral treatment. Although not considered significant in the overall GWAS, it exhibited significance in the subgroup analysis.
title: A machine learning-based SNP-set analysis approach for identifying disease-associated susceptibility loci

finding: The rs2308321-G variant in MGMT was associated with decreased survival in glioma cases treated with TMZ, resulting in a median survival reduction of 5.5 months compared to AA genotype carriers. This effect was not observed in cases without TMZ treatment.
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: This lead SNP at locus 10p11.21 showed a discovery p-value of 1.93×10^-6 and OR=3.61, being located 938 kb from FZD8, which is associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: This SNP achieved suggestive significance in the meta-analysis (p=8.36×10^-7, OR=3.04) and resided in a gene desert at locus 10p15.3.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The study identified rs6481586 as a lead variant associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), demonstrating differing effects in both HCM and dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM). Summary statistics revealed distinct effect and non-effect alleles, with opposite directions of effect denoted by the regression coefficient. This finding underscored the importance of this SNP in understanding the genetic landscape of HCM.
title: Large scale genome-wide association analyses identify novel genetic loci and mechanisms in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

finding: The SNP rs1414756 in the NRG3 gene was indicated to elevate the risk of IR, with the T allele associated with increased risk (for C/T: OR = 2.38; 95% CI: 1.18-4.79; p = 0.0009; for T/T: OR = 12.20; 95% CI: 1.55-95.82; p = 0.0009), operating under a codominant inheritance model.
title: Unveiling Genetic Associations: Investigating CLDN16, GRID2, NRG3, and CACNG4 Gene Polymorphisms with Insulin Resistance Risk Among Normal BMI Individuals in the Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs11101591 was associated with the effectiveness of drug combinations, particularly in the context of optimizing treatment for Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia, indicating its relevance in drug resistance mechanisms.
title: Trending Drugs Combination to Target Leukemia associated Proteins/Genes: using Graph Neural Networks under the RAIN Protocol

finding: The rs75042057 SNP, located at 10p11.21, also demonstrated a genome-wide significant association with impulsivity with a p-value of 3.6 × 10^-8. This SNP falls within intron 22 of the PARD3 gene, contributing to 9.3% of the phenotypic variation in the study, and previous linkage studies indicated association with idiopathic generalized epilepsy, further supporting its potential role in impulsivity.
title: SLCO5A1 and synaptic assembly genes contribute to impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy

finding: This variant was linked to serum calcium levels and is located downstream of GATA3.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The variant <italic>ARMS2/HTRA1</italic>:rs3750846-C was identified as being significantly associated with PS thinning, reinforcing its role as a genetic contributor to AMD risk.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The SNP rs12217518 exhibited a significantly higher frequency of HRG in TN cases (84%) compared to control subjects (76%). Cases carrying the HRG were found to be more frequently idiopathic than those carrying LRG, although these differences were not statistically significant.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The study referenced by Fritsche et al. (2018) indicated that the genetic variation in the SNP TCF7L2 rs7903146 had a negative and independent impact on diabetes-associated metabolic traits in individuals with a history of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM). This finding was significant as it highlighted the role of this SNP in influencing metabolic responses, underlying diabetes risk in relation to GDM.
title: Incretin hypersecretion in gestational diabetes mellitus

finding: This SNP exhibited evidence of paternal origin bias in inheritance patterns related to preeclampsia, suggesting a potential role of paternal alleles in influencing the condition.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: It was noted as the likely causal SNP for the GLUD1 excitatory neuron eQTL, with a causal probability of 0.87. The GLUD1 gene plays an important role in inhibitory synapse formation.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: It was positioned in a microglia enhancer associated with USP6NL and predicted to disrupt KLF5 binding, highlighting a genetic mechanism in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: rs10828248 was identified as a lead SNP on chromosome 10 linked to chronic dizziness in the European GWAS, with a significant P-value of 3.17 × 10−08. This SNP was found to be in moderate to high linkage disequilibrium with rs12779865.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: This SNP, found on chromosome 10, was related to chronic dizziness and showed high linkage disequilibrium with rs10828248, indicating a consistent association across different ancestry groups.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The rs35563099 SNP, located near RAB11FIP2, was identified as having a potential role in keratinocyte cancer progression due to its association with cancer cell migration.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Similar to rs35563099, rs7098111 was found near RAB11FIP2 and linked to keratinocyte cancer progression.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: An intronic variant in IL2RA, it was associated with immune tolerance and regulation linked to several autoimmune disorders.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs2253202 was associated with the KCNMA1 gene, which is crucial for controlling neuronal excitability. It was found that mutations in this gene lead to developmental delays and seizures. This connection was relevant in understanding how early education activities such as Reading for Pleasure (RfP) could influence cognitive performance.
title: Early Childhood Reading for Pleasure: Evidence from the ABCD Study for Benefits to Cognitive Performance and Mental Health and Associated Changes in Brain Structure

finding: The SNP rs10999029 was linked with the COL13A1 gene, which plays a role in the formation of synaptic extracellular matrices at neuromuscular synapses. This finding was significant in the context of the beneficial effects of early RfP on cognition and the neurobiological mechanisms underlying these educational experiences.
title: Early Childhood Reading for Pleasure: Evidence from the ABCD Study for Benefits to Cognitive Performance and Mental Health and Associated Changes in Brain Structure

finding: This SNP was associated with DD in an intergenic region linked to SFTPA2, showing a significant association with an odds ratio of 0.92.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP within the FGFR2 gene was associated with DD and indicated heightened risk linked to skeletal abnormalities.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: The study documented the association of the DCM-associated SNP rs2234962 with an increased risk of idiopathic cardiomyopathy. This SNP demonstrated a complex interaction as it was found to be in tight linkage disequilibrium with the PD-associated SNP rs72840788, revealing contrasting genetic implications in cardiomyopathy and Parkinson’s disease.
title: Role of BAG3 protein interactions in cardiomyopathies

finding: The PD-associated SNP rs72840788 was highlighted in the context of its linkage with the DCM-associated SNP rs2234962, showing a genetic relationship where the risk allele for DCM appeared to protect against Parkinson’s disease. This inverse association underlined the need for deeper investigation into BAG3's multifaceted interactions.
title: Role of BAG3 protein interactions in cardiomyopathies

finding: The SNP rs111245635 was significantly associated with RBP3, encoding a protein involved in retinoid transport, and linked with inherited retinal diseases indicating its role in affecting PRC layer thickness.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs60401382 was significantly associated with HTRA1, linked to AMD, further emphasizing its impact on PRC morphology.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs55798570 was found associated with CDHR1, involved in several inherited retinal dystrophies, impacting IS thickness across different macular segments.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs17102399 associated with FGFR2 was found to influence both PRC layer thickness and breast cancer risk, indicating potential common molecular pathways.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs560595454 was identified in gene INPP5A with a genome-wide significant association to tuberculosis (p<5E-08).
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: Identified in the gene INPP5A, rs562763274 was associated with tuberculosis in the FinnGen study demonstrating significant results.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: SNP rs145176301 achieved statistical significance (p=7.7E-04) and was a part of previously recognized risk factors for tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The rs2629540 variant in the 10q26.13 locus was associated with cognitive abilities such as math ability and education, showing connections with specific functional areas in the temporal and parietal lobes.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The variant rs1314013 at the ZEB1 locus was associated with weight, showing strong statistical significance with a p-value of 7.19 × 10^-11 in KoGES and 2.7 × 10^-4 in BBJ.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The SNP rs4918003 demonstrated significant regulatory potential according to RegulomeDB, with the most potent evidence of affecting transcription factor binding (RDB: 1b). This regulatory significance underlines its potential role in modifying genetic risk for related phenotypes.
title: Disentangling shared genetic etiologies for kidney function and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The rs4284332 SNP, associated with the CHST3 gene, similarly showed a correlation with the accumulation of diagnoses for lumbar disc herniation before the age of 30, suggesting its involvement in early onset risks for LDH.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis conducted in three large biobanks expands the genetic landscape of lumbar disc herniations

finding: The SNP rs11010126 was found to be associated with HLA-I allele-specific expression loss, which was pervasive across multiple tumor types including pancreatic adenocarcinomas. The allele-specific loss was significantly correlated with worse overall survival outcomes and impaired responses to immunotherapy, indicating its clinical relevance.
title: HLA allele-specific expression loss in tumors can shorten survival and hinder immunotherapy

finding: This SNP indicated adverse effects on Aβ pathology; it showed a negative correlation in males (-0.33SD, SE=0.07, p=1.0*10^-6) while having a positive association in females (+0.18SD, SE=0.06, p=4.2*10^-3), highlighting its sex-dependent interaction.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The rs7922621 variant at the TSPAN14 locus had one of the top signals for Alzheimer's disease (AD) across both European and Black/African American ancestries, indicating its significant role in AD etiology.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The rs10748818 variant at the GBF1 locus showed the highest estimated PAR for the African/African Admixed population, indicating its significance in PD etiology.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: This SNP was previously found to be highly associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and exhibited a high linkage disequilibrium with the structural variant SV10995, indicating a potential influence on AMD risk.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was similarly associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with SV10995, suggesting its possible role in modifying AMD risk.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was identified as strongly associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and exhibited high linkage disequilibrium with the structural variant SV10995, further supporting its relevance in AMD susceptibility.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was found to be highly associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and had a strong linkage disequilibrium with SV10995, indicating its potential genetic influence on AMD.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was strongly linked to age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and was found in perfect linkage disequilibrium with SV10995, further reinforcing its association with AMD risk.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was also identified as significantly associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium with SV10995, highlighting its potential role in AMD pathology.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: The rs121909241 SNP was found in the context of the major expressed allele frequency of PTEN in patient POG041, where a frameshift mutation occurred on the minor allele and a missense mutation on the major expressed allele. This double hit knockout scenario was consistent with aberrant cis-acting regulatory mechanisms associated with PTEN's allelic expression, indicating its role in tumor suppressor gene inactivation.
title: Long-read sequencing of an advanced cancer cohort resolves rearrangements, unravels haplotypes, and reveals methylation landscapes

finding: The variant rs12251016 at locus 10p12.31 was associated with insomnia and shared genetic influences with DTI parameters.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The rs4244285 (CYP2C19 *2 allele, 681G>A) was identified as a loss-of-function variant. The meta-analysis found that in patients with a recent TIA or minor ischemic stroke, the odds ratio for major adverse cardiac events (MACE) was 0.84 for CYP2C19 variant carriers, suggesting a reduced clopidogrel metabolism and lower efficacy.
title: CYP2C19 and effect of clopidogrel for secondary prevention of major ischemic events: systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs4986893 (CYP2C19 *3 allele, 636G>A) was also characterized as a loss-of-function variant. Similar to rs4244285, this variant was associated with an odds ratio of 0.84 for MACE in CYP2C19 variant carriers in patients with a recent TIA or minor ischemic stroke, indicating its impact on clopidogrel efficacy.
title: CYP2C19 and effect of clopidogrel for secondary prevention of major ischemic events: systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs10886902, linked to a gene at 10q26.12, was identified as being significantly associated with PSA levels in the meta-analysis, contributing to improved diagnostics.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP in the MSMB gene was established as a significant contributor to PSA variations, enhancing the understanding of prostate cancer screening.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The ARMS2:rs3750846-C variant was genome-wide significantly associated with PS thinning, suggesting it plays a role in the genetic predisposition towards AMD.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: This SNP was associated with downregulation of IL2RA expression, supporting its prioritization over IL15RA at the locus.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: In the 10q23.33 region, rs11187838 was implicated with migraine, demonstrating significant associations with the auditory and cingulo-opercular networks in resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: Associated with cognitive functions like math ability and education, rs2629540 was linked prominently to the precuneus in various networks.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The common frameshift variant rs145843135 (MAF=5.4%) was associated with a reduced risk for rosacea (OR: 0.88), demonstrating reduced expression of the PNLIPRP3 gene in skin tissue.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The genetic signal at rs10882555 (MAF=45%) was significantly associated with a decreased risk for rosacea, with an OR of 0.90, tagging a missense variant in C10orf129.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The missense variant rs591157 was likely tagged by rs10882555 and involved in breaking down 3-hydroxy-2-ethylpropionate in lipid metabolism, influencing rosacea risk.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The SNP rs10995566 at 10q21.3 was shown to be significantly associated with MacTel (P=4.8×10^-8), highlighting its importance in disease etiology.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs1358030, located near the SORCS1 gene on chromosome 10q25.1, was similarly identified in a GWAS as having an indirect association with time-to-diabetic retinopathy (DR) and time-to-diabetic nephropathy (DN) via the longitudinal risk factor Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c). As with rs10810632, the analysis noted that increasing the sample size could enhance the classification of its association with T1DC traits.
title: Characterization of direct and/or indirect genetic associations for multiple traits in longitudinal studies of disease progression

finding: The missense variant rs143282422 in CDH23 (Ala371Thr) was identified as a putatively causal variant associated with hearing loss, suggesting its role in the genetic architecture of this condition.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The intronic variant rs10901863 in CTBP2 was prioritized as a potentially causal variant contributing to the risk of hearing loss, highlighting its importance in the genetic underpinnings of this phenotype.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The tag eSNP rs11195272 demonstrated significant effects on gene expression of DUSP5 in males after GR-stimulation, with a reported FDR of 0.046, indicating the responsiveness of this gene to GR activation.
title: Sex differences in the genetic regulation of the blood transcriptome response to glucocorticoid receptor activation

finding: This variant specifically linked to male individuals, reinforcing its relevance in POAG risk stratification.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP was defined as a leading signal in the context of POAG linked to several ocular conditions.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The study found that SNP rs75935441, situated in the 3' untranslated region of the prolactin releasing hormone receptor gene (PRLHR) on chromosome 10, was significantly associated with astrovirus diarrheal infections. Children carrying at least one C allele were four times more likely to be affected than those with the T allele, establishing another critical genetic region influencing susceptibility.
title: Genetic Susceptibility to Astrovirus Diarrhea in Bangladeshi Infants

finding: The SNP rs1324319 was associated with traits like IBS, hinting at a relation to gastrointestinal conditions and was significant but did not lead to notable associations in regard to direct COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP rs10826861 significantly affected methylation at the site cg20673407, with a beta value of -1.40, a standard error of 0.05, and a p-value of 4.15×10^-33. This indicated a strong association between the SNP and the methylation levels at this site, revealing its potential role in the epigenetic landscape associated with osteoarthritis.
title: Epigenomic profiling of the infrapatellar fat pad in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs10821936 was associated with a meQTL related to the gene ARID5B. This finding was reported in both neutrophils and naïve CD4+ T cells from lupus patients, indicating its relevance to the disease.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: This variant showed a concordance rate of 100% when genotyped against the Agena VeriDose Core methodology, affirming its reliability and significance as a finding.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The SNP rs1057910 also achieved a concordance rate of 100% with the benchmark tests, marking it as a significant finding relevant to pharmacogenomics related to drug metabolism.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The rs11187838 variant in the 10q23.33 region was associated with migraine and affected multiple brain networks, showcasing its relevance in both the auditory and cingulo-opercular networks.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2629540 variant in the 10q26.13 locus was implicated in cognitive functions, particularly in math ability, and showed associations with areas in the temporal and parietal lobes during fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The previously reported lead variant rs3934643:G>A in SFTPD associated with hospitalization and lung function significantly.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: SNP rs10822056 was shown to have significant associations with traits identified by TraitScan, including alkaline phosphatase. The MR analysis suggested EWS was causally related to lower alkaline phosphatase levels, indicating a potential link between this SNP and EWS.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: rs10998283 showed a significant association with ALL (P = 3.92 x 10^-8, OR = 1.15) within the TET1 gene locus. The association was initially identified in Latino participants and was supported by nominal replication in independent cohorts.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: rs9415680 exhibited a significant association with ALL (P = 7.27 x 10^-8, OR = 1.20) at the JMJD1C/NRBF2 locus. This locus presented two independent association signals, primarily influenced by Latino participants.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: This SNP was linked to the NEBL locus and had a minor allele frequency of 0.6%, with an odds ratio of 1.65, underscoring its association with AF in East Asian populations.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This SNP was identified at the NEURL1 locus, with a minor allele frequency of 0.5% and an odds ratio of 1.68, also affirming its relevance to AF in East Asian individuals.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This SNP was associated with cell adhesion regulation, indicating its possible role in heart morphogenesis and AF susceptibility.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: The study identified rs1247117 as the most significant functional regulatory variant impacting PU.1 transcription factor binding and thus altering sensitivity to vincristine in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). The G allele at rs1247117 demonstrated greater PU.1 binding affinity compared to the A allele, leading to enhanced chromatin accessibility and reduced expression of nearby genes including CACUL1, which was associated with vincristine resistance. The deletion of the region containing rs1247117 resulted in increased sensitivity to vincristine, supporting the role of this SNP in chemotherapeutic response.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: The variant rs3824662 was found to be associated with ALL susceptibility and demonstrated significant allelic effects in multiple ALL cell lines. The risk A allele at this locus was correlated with increased expression of GATA3, indicating its role in regulating therapeutic outcomes in ALL.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: rs1312895 was identified as being in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs1247117 and was associated with persistence of minimal residual disease (MRD) after induction chemotherapy, marking its contribution to chemotherapeutic resistance in ALL.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: This SNP was closely linked to rs1247117 with perfect LD and was also implicated in persistence of MRD after chemotherapy, indicating its significance in drug response mechanisms.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: The sentinel SNP rs146800892 from the PRKG1 locus exhibited a significant association with levels of glycocholic acid (GCA) but was detected primarily in the CROATIA-Vis cohort, which suggested a cohort-specific association due to the rarity of the allele (MAF < 1%). The findings indicated that this SNP had a larger effect in females (beta = -0.79, p-value = 8.26 × 10^-11) compared to males (beta = -0.18, p-value = 1.81 × 10^-1).
title: Genome-wide association study reveals loci with sex-specific effects on plasma bile acids

finding: The SNP rs117834398, also in the PRKG1 locus, showed a sex-specific association with GCA in females (beta = -0.79) compared to males (beta = -0.18), with significance only in the female-specific analysis (p-value = 8.26×10^-11), indicating independent associations within the PRKG1 locus related to bile acid variation.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals loci with sex-specific effects on plasma bile acids

finding: SNP rs7902587 was positioned in the Erythroblast-like enhancer sequence class, enriched in enhancer histone marks. This index SNP, linked to prostate cancer, was verified to have a maximum log e-value greater than 2 using the DeepSEA Beluga model, reflecting its regulatory importance.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The rs121918312 SNP corresponds to a mutation in the BAG3 gene, where proline at the 209th amino acid is changed to leucine (p.Pro209Leu). This mutation is a known genetic cause of myofibrillar myopathy 6 (MFM6), a severe childhood-onset myopathy characterized by muscle weakness and cardiomyopathy. The mutation was found to act in a dominant manner and is primarily attributed to de novo occurrences in affected individuals.
title: Personalized allele-specific CRISPR-Cas9 strategies for myofibrillar myopathy 6

finding: This G/T variant located at the intergenic region of NUTM2A and NUTM2D showed significance in the context of Long COVID despite not providing extensive functional data.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: SNP rs11191548 was identified as having a considerable impact on the association whereby its removal notably decreased the effect size and weakened statistical evidence for the increased risk of schizophrenia associated with systolic blood pressure.
title: Exploring the relationship between schizophrenia and cardiovascular disease: A genetic correlation and multivariable Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs792212 at the RNLS locus (10q23.31) reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.91x10^-9 in relation to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The lead variant rs61871747, located in the HTRA1/ARMS2 locus, showed significant between-ancestry heterogeneity with no effect difference between ancestries indicated by overlapping 95% confidence intervals excluding unity. It was linked to advanced AMD with odds ratios ranging from 2.03 to 2.92.
title: Diverse ancestry GWAS for advanced age-related macular degeneration in TOPMed-imputed and Ophthalmologically-confirmed 16,108 cases and 18,038 controls

finding: The SNP rs2981578, located on chromosome 10q26 within an intron of FGFR2, was identified in a study examining breast cancer risk and was shown to have a strong linkage disequilibrium with discovered haplotypes. The hazard ratio was reported at 1.25, indicating its role in elevating breast cancer risk.
title: Potential Misrepresentation of Inherited Breast Cancer Risk by Common Germline Alleles

finding: The SNP rs1899888, also part of the gene EFEMP1, was found to be associated with inguinal hernia in the same GWAS that included 18,791 cases. Like rs56046099, this variant was linked to the function of fibulin-3 in connective tissue and was involved in previously established interactions related to the pathophysiology of inguinal hernia.
title: No causal association between inguinal hernia and aortic aneurysm using Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The SNP rs1006545 was one of the male-specific SNPs related to CRF-slope, indirectly associated in the combined sample (r²=0.97 with rs11190709) without evidence of heterogeneity.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The SNP rs9419958 at the OBFC1 locus was identified as a colocalised variant between LTL and lung adenocarcinoma, presenting potential implications for telomere maintenance in cancer.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: The variant rs139122544 within OBFC1 also displayed evidence of colocalisation with both LTL and lung adenocarcinoma, implicating it in the shared genetic mechanism of these traits.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs373205748 was significant only in the multi-ancestry meta-analysis, with an allele frequency of 0.08% in South Asians. This finding contributed to understanding genetic heterogeneity in heart failure and highlighted the necessity of including multi-ancestry samples for genetic research.
title: Polygenic risk score from a multi-ancestry GWAS uncovers susceptibility of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs10828248 on chromosome 10 was identified as a significant locus in the GWAS for chronic dizziness in European ancestry, demonstrating a P-value of 3.17 × 10^-8. It was also replicated in the Ice/Fin/UKB/US cohort.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs12779865 on chromosome 10 showed significant associations across GWAS studies, particularly being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs10828248.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs2031617 was discussed in relation to the role of ZEB1 in pancreatic cancer, reinforcing its potential impact on cancer progression and treatment strategies.
title: Graph Attention Networks for Drug Combination Discovery: Targeting Pancreatic Cancer Genes with RAIN Protocol

finding: SNP rs3011351 was included in studies evaluating the mechanisms of action of cisplatin as an anti-tumor drug, emphasizing its relevance in pancreatic cancer treatment research.
title: Graph Attention Networks for Drug Combination Discovery: Targeting Pancreatic Cancer Genes with RAIN Protocol

finding: The SNP rs72845653 was identified as a female-specific genome-wide significant signal at locus 10q24.32, where KCNIP2 was implicated. It showed significant sex-heterogeneity and opposite effect directions in females and males.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of over 29,000 people with epilepsy reveals 26 loci and subtype-specific genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs11191156 was associated with genetic generalized epilepsy (GGE) and was recognized in the main GGE meta-analysis. It was related to the gene KCNIP2, which had another significant signal at locus 10q24.32.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of over 29,000 people with epilepsy reveals 26 loci and subtype-specific genetic architecture

finding: This PYROXD2 gene variant indicated a significant interaction with LTST on LDL-c levels, emphasizing its role in the complex relationship between sleep duration and lipid metrics.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: Variants in GPAM, including rs10787429, were associated with elevated serum ALT levels (p=2.8×10^-39). This finding was significant in relation to liver fat measurements and replicated across multiple independent cohorts, highlighting its relevance to NAFLD and ARLD.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: This SNP was associated with liver fat by MR imaging in GPAM with a significant p-value of 3.6×10^-13, emphasizing its impact on liver health.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: The SNP rs7100474 in BICC1 was identified through meta-analysis as being associated with high myopia, reflected by a significant P-value of 2.02 × 10^-8.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: rs11191580 was associated with autism spectrum disorder in a Chinese Han population, indicating its potential role in the genetic basis of autism.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: The rs7922621 variant at the TSPAN14 locus represented one of the top signals in the context of Alzheimer's disease across both European and Black/African American ancestries, contributing significantly to the Population Attributable Risk (PAR).
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The rs10748818 variant at the GBF1 locus exhibited the highest estimated PAR for the African/African Admixed population in association with Parkinson's disease, linking it to intracellular protein traffic modulation.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The SNP rs2476491 was associated with pernicious anemia (p=1.90 × 10⁻⁸, OR=1.22) and located intronically in the IL2RA gene, which plays a role in immune regulation and has connections to multiple autoimmune diseases.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies five risk loci for pernicious anemia and implicates the role of HLA-DR15 haplotype

finding: The SNP rs982764 was identified as a sentinel pQTL for plasma soluble FAS levels and was strongly associated with the risk of severe COVID-19. Specifically, the major allele (T) was linked to higher circulating soluble FAS and increased risk of severe disease. Further analyses indicated that the risk allele (T) contributed to alternative splicing, leading to an increase in transcripts lacking exon 6, which resulted in elevated levels of soluble FAS. This finding highlighted a novel genetic mechanism contributing to the risk of severe COVID-19.
title: Mendelian randomisation identifies alternative splicing of the FAS death receptor as a mediator of severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs7918269 exhibited a significant association with Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) susceptibility, indicated by a p-value of 1.600000e-09. This finding was described as the most significant result in the study and was derived from a dataset with favorable characteristics such as a minor allele frequency of 0.01 and a stringent linkage disequilibrium threshold.
title: Enhanced Data Pre-processing for the Identification of Alzheimer’s Disease-Associated SNPs

finding: The variant rs12248560, which corresponds to CYP2C19*17, was noted to contribute to categorizing individuals as rapid and ultrarapid metabolizers of proton pump inhibitors (PPIs). These metabolizers were found to have a heightened risk for pneumonia (HR 1.45, 95% CI 1.22-1.73) when using PPIs, establishing a direct impact of this SNP on PPI metabolism and associated health risks.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to pneumonia, influenza, and COVID-19: evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The SNP rs17884712, associated with CYP2C19*9, played a role in the subgroup analysis of PPI users, aiding in the classification of metabolic phenotypes. While specific hazard ratios for pneumonia or influenza were not detailed for this SNP, its inclusion in the metabolic categorization highlights its relevance in understanding PPI-related risks.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to pneumonia, influenza, and COVID-19: evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The SNP rs4986893, identified as CYP2C19*3, was among the four variants used to determine metabolic status among PPI users. Although individual impacts on pneumonia or influenza risks were not explicitly detailed, this variant was crucial in classifying users as likely intermediate, intermediate, or poor metabolizers of PPIs.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to pneumonia, influenza, and COVID-19: evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The genetic variant rs4244285, encoding CYP2C19*2, contributed to the classification of PPI users into different metabolizer categories, thereby playing an integral role in determining susceptibility to pneumonia and influenza for patients metabolizing PPIs at different rates.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to pneumonia, influenza, and COVID-19: evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: This missense variant in BAG3 was noted for its enrichment among patients with dilated cardiomyopathy, linking it to cardiac failure through potential molecular dysfunction.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: As a tag for BAG3, this SNP highlighted its association with cardiomyopathy and indicated a mutation relevant to heart disease pathways.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The rs4309079 locus was associated with single-layer positive global efficiency, indicating its role in functional connectivity. This finding was linked to the INPP5A gene, which is known for its involvement in calcium signaling, a critical cellular mechanism related to neurological pathways and functional connectivity. The finding was consistent with existing research showing that variations at this locus were connected to brain age and changes in functional connectivity.
title: Sex differences in functional network topology over the course of aging in 37543 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs2152237 locus was identified near the ADARB2 gene, which is involved in the ATP/ITP metabolic pathway. This association was relevant to multiplex clustering measures and contributed to understanding the genetic influences on functional connectivity in the brain and the changes observed during healthy aging.
title: Sex differences in functional network topology over the course of aging in 37543 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs10882283 SNP in the gene RBP4 was determined as a reliable instrumental variable for circulating retinol. It exhibited a clear association with retinol levels and was used to estimate causal effects on various clinical outcomes.
title: Genetic influences on circulating retinol and its relationship to human health

finding: SNP rs4919626 was documented as an intronic variant in GBF1 associated with cannabis use disorder (CUD) and confirmed within the MTAG analysis.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs10884186 was identified as a significant variant associated with SORCS3 and its linkage to substance use attributes.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The CYP2C9 rs9332172 variant was identified in association with a 'putative novel oxylipin,' marking it as part of a potential distinct genetic mechanism for this specific metabolite.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The SNP rs1800450, located in the mannose binding lectin gene 2 (MBL2), was found to be associated with the development and severity of COVID-19 infection. This finding was relevant as it indicated the SNP's role in modulating immune response, which is critical during SARS-CoV-2 infections. The research highlighted the importance of this variant in understanding individual susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: Precise blood proteome profiling in an undiagnosed population with COVID-19

finding: This SNP was associated with Subtype I, marking its relevance to mild progression patterns in Parkinson's disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with Subtype I, which reflects its association with milder onset and slower progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs2644520 was associated with aripiprazole-induced triglyceride (TG) changes (p = 3.06e-08, FDR = 0.122) and was located in an intergenic region near the SORCS1 gene.
title: Pharmacogenetic Study of Antipsychotic-Induced Lipid and BMI Changes in Chinese Schizophrenia Patients: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs11597285 was identified as being associated with the <italic>Collinsella</italic> genus, which has been linked to allergic diseases, including allergic rhinitis and eczema. This association was noted while conducting an examination of SNPs related to significant bacterial taxa suspected to influence immune-related adverse effects (irAEs) among cancer patients treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors.
title: Appraising the causal association between gut microbiota and immune-related adverse events: perspectives from a bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs927346 showed significant eQTL effects for HLA-DQB1 in B cells, emphasizing similar state-dependent patterns to HLA-DQA1 with strong effects observed in plasmablasts.
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The rs7903146 SNP was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) as demonstrated by its inclusion in a polygenic risk score (PRS) derived from multiple ancestry groups. The SNP showed strong evidence of association with T2D, indicating its potential role in identifying individuals at risk for developing undiagnosed diabetes.
title: A polygenic risk score identifies undiagnosed cases of diabetes

finding: The SNP rs12247015, located in the 5' UTR of TFAM, was also significantly associated with mtCN in the EUR cohort (βA allele = 0.039, p = 1.14 × 10⁻⁵), confirming its role in mitochondrial DNA copy number variation.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of mtDNA copy number in a multi-ancestry cohort

finding: This SNP emerged as the lead SNP for UGIT, indicating its previously recognized significance in chronic pain, alongside the identification of a solitary independent signal at its locus.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The deletion mismatch tagged by rs2342606 was associated with AR time with an HR of 1.373 (95% CI: 1.011–1.865, P = 0.042). It was also linked with increased expression of TMEM254 and other related genes across multiple tissues and was noted to tag the deletions of LOC642521 and LOC642538.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: SNP rs1577857, linked to RP11-655H13.2, was identified in the MaxAlc study with a significant association (p=2.47×10^-08), confirming its relevance to alcohol-related behavior.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: This variant was found to be associated with lung cancer (LC) in the latest meta-analysis, specifically nearby the OBFC1/STN1 gene.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs7903146, located at the TCF7L2 locus, was identified as one of the seven shared SNPs between type 2 diabetes and PHQ-9 depression.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs11817236 was related to the ANK3 locus, which is associated with neurodevelopmental disorders. In the context of atopic dermatitis, it was hypothesized to influence keratinocyte-mediated inflammatory responses, showing varying expression levels in T-cells and keratinocytes.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The rs12722497 SNP increased IL2RA plasma levels and contributed to variation, potentially impacting regulatory T cell function and related autoimmune responses.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs2104286 SNP associated with decreased IL2RA plasma levels and might alter T cell modulation, indicating its role in immune responses.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs12722489 SNP, previously reported as an eQTL and pQTL for IL2RA, was noted for its association with susceptibility to multiple diseases. It was linked to the modulation of IL2RA levels.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The SNP rs4933752, a proxy variant for rs34350548, was nominally significant in the replication analysis against the FinnGen severe TBI phenotype, nearest to the EXOC6 gene.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: Associated with the duplication at chr10:135351137-135427847, this SNP had a reported p-value of 0.06 in a GWAS of general intelligence. The duplications in this region were previously linked to intellectual disability, indicating its relevance to cognitive functioning.
title: The copy number variant architecture of psychopathology and cognitive development in the ABCD® study

finding: The rs1133400 SNP was identified as a missense variant in the PLCE1 gene, associated with lower system segregation. Additionally, it was linked to higher body fat percentage and higher blood pressure, highlighting its impact on cognitive performance.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs138004790 SNP was associated with regulatory functions near INPP5A and revealed a link to lower system segregation, suggesting its influence on the modulation of functional connectivity in the brain.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: Similar to rs138004790, the rs9645539 SNP was also associated with regulatory activity flanking INPP5A and connected to lower system segregation, further underpinning its role in neurobiology.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs2274224 SNP was identified as a lead SNP linked to lower system segregation and was highlighted for its regulatory function relating to the PLCE1 gene, emphasizing its role in vascular mechanisms affecting cognition.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs11596664 SNP was noted as a high LD proxy for rs9645539, and was linked to frontal cortex connectivity, establishing a connection with cognitive performance related to system segregation.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The SNP rs143042901, mapped to the intronic region of the PLEKHA1 gene, was part of the four novel anxiety loci identified, although no specific functional insights were noted.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: SNP rs61753077, located in the exonic region of the TACC2 gene, was part of the identified novel loci for anxiety but lacked additional context regarding functionality.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs2015583 was found to have a strong association with leprosy in African populations, showing a combined p-value of 8.81 × 10−9 and an odds ratio of 0.51 (95% CI 0.40 - 0.64). It was identified as a novel susceptibility locus at 10q24, which modified ACTR1A RNA expression in CD4+ T cells. This variant conferred reduced susceptibility to leprosy and was notable for its pleiotropic effects on inflammatory bowel disease and atopic disease.
title: ACTR1A has pleiotropic effects on risk of leprosy, inflammatory bowel disease and atopy

finding: The missense SNP rs780668 in the gene SLC29A3 was replicated in the study, showcasing a p-value of 0.034 and an odds ratio of 1.28 (95% CI 1.02 - 1.60) for its association with leprosy risk.
title: ACTR1A has pleiotropic effects on risk of leprosy, inflammatory bowel disease and atopy

finding: This European-specific variant showed significant associations in male populations and highlights possible distinct mechanisms in POAG pathology.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs11190559 SNP showed significant TWAS association with ocular-related traits, suggesting potential involvement in mechanisms related to eye pathologies including POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The variant rs183893500 was mapped to CTBP2, showing potential implications in cochlear ribbon synapse functionality and its role in sensorineural HL.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs2147896 was found to be associated with N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine missingness and showed significant mediation between gene expression and metabolite missingness.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: SNP rs722988 in the NRP1 locus exhibited strong association with both type 1 diabetes risk (OR = 1.61, P = 1.10 x 10^-8) and age at onset specifically in African and admixed ancestry individuals, marking its significance in these populations.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: SNP rs2018705 in the RNLS locus showed association with age at onset (OR = 1.18, P = 1.11 x 10^-7), which was similar in effect direction to type 1 diabetes risk, underscoring its relevance in disease risk assessment.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs137998089 was identified in the female-specific analysis within the LRMDA gene on chromosome 10, exhibiting a significant p-value of 4.04 x 10^-8. This locus was linked to widespread pain in females.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Widespread Pain in the UK Biobank (N=172,230)

finding: The intronic variant rs139862664 in ENO4 was associated with male infertility, displaying a significant protective association with an odds ratio of 0.388, linking it to sperm motility functions.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The LRMDA locus variant rs114026383 reached genome-wide significance with an OR of 2.42 and P-value of 1.82×10⁻⁸ in non-European participants.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The SNP rs11597285 was associated with the genus <italic>Collinsella</italic>, which had previous associations with allergic diseases such as allergic rhinitis and eczema. Despite its association with allergic disease, analysis showed that the findings for <italic>Collinsella</italic> remained significant and unaffected by the removal of this SNP in the Leave-One-Out (LOO) analysis.
title: Univariable and multivariable Mendelian randomization study identified the key role of gut microbiota in immunotherapeutic toxicity

finding: Variant rs61872084 resulted in decreased NKX2-5 DNA binding and was associated with the gene METTL10, which was downregulated when the alternate allele was present in the heart's left ventricle.
title: Prioritizing Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Variants Altering NKX2-5 Binding through an Integrative Computational Approach

finding: Included in the top 5 IBI SNPs, this SNP was crucial for examining individualized genomic variants impacting hypertension.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: Recognized as a likely cause of hypertension in a minority of patients, this SNP highlights the promise of personalized genomic analyses by IBI.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: Linked to the odds of missingness of N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine, this SNP also indicated a mediation effect with gene expression, connecting it to metabolic dysfunction in trimethylaminuria.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: This SNP was associated with the missingness of various metabolites, specifically noting interactions involving PYROXD2 and metabolic processes tied to mitochondrial function.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs603424, located near the SCD gene, demonstrated significant associations with 24 different lipid species. This result suggested its potential role in lipid metabolism and implications for coronary artery disease.
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs10553596, located in the CASP7 gene, was identified as a potential facilitator of genetic resilience in APOE-ε4 carriers, suggesting it played a role in moderating genetic risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). This finding was based on a comparison of resilient individuals at high genetic risk with LOAD cases, highlighting its relevance in understanding genetic modifiers of disease.
title: Polygenic resilience scores capture protective genetic effects for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11511253 demonstrated an association with lipoedema, with a meta-analysis P-value of 4.07 x 10⁻⁵ and odds ratio of 1.67. This SNP influenced the expression of several genes and pseudogenes known to be expressed in lipoedema-related tissues such as subcutaneous adipose tissue.
