title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: The SNP rs10993994 was associated with MSMB gene expression, which was identified as the genome-wide top-most predictive gene for distinguishing benign regions from high-grade cancer regions. The study found that high-grade cancer regions had five-fold lower MSMB expression compared to benign regions. Additionally, MSMB exhibited an inverse association with prostate cancer overall (Odds Ratio [OR] = 0.81, 95% Confidence Interval [CI]: 0.80-0.82), as well as with aggressive (OR = 0.84, 95% CI: 0.82-0.86) and early onset breast cancer (OR = 0.71, 95% CI: 0.68-0.74). This finding highlighted the significance of the MSMB protein in the context of prostate cancer risk.
title: Identifying proteomic risk factors for overall, aggressive and early onset prostate cancer using Mendelian randomization and tumor spatial transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was shown to be part of predisposing haplotypes that influenced the penetrance of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR), particularly when homozygous, thus increasing disease risk substantially.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: Similar to rs2506030, this SNP was implicated in the formation of predisposing haplotypes that significantly raised the risk of developing HSCR, especially in homozygous combinations.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: Associated with predisposing haplotypes that affect HSCR risk, this SNP also contributed to substantial disease risk when present in homozygous form.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: The variant rs189569984 in RBM20 was associated with left ventricular end-systolic volume, right ventricular end-systolic volume, and left ventricular ejection fraction, with strong effect sizes indicating its relevance to cardiovascular function (P values reaching 9.1 × 10^-16 for LVESV).
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: Identified as the second most significant novel locus for pneumonia, the lead SNP rs10762653 had a notable credible set of variants. Its association indicated involvement in pneumonia susceptibility, albeit with a smaller credible set than the most significant locus.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: The C allele at the TCF7L2 locus (rs7901695) for type 2 diabetes demonstrated a significant disparity in allele frequency across populations, with a notable increase from 0.013 in the Chinese populations (CHB) to 0.488 in the African population. This finding contributed to the overall pattern of higher predicted risks of type 2 diabetes among African populations compared to East Asian populations.
title: Polygenic adaptation is not a major driver of disparities in disease mortality across global populations

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with asthma at a significance level of p = 2.5×10^-9. It resides within the PLCE1 gene, which is an autosomal recessive nephrotic syndrome gene. The study highlighted a connection between atopic disorders, including asthma, and nephrotic syndrome in children, indicating potential shared underlying pathways.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: The damaging variant in <italic>ECHDC3</italic> (chr10:11678309:A:C) was also found to co-segregate with common variants in EFIGA families, emphasizing its potential role in the familial Alzheimer's disease context.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was found to reside in the PLCE1 gene, previously associated with an autosomal recessive nephrotic syndrome. The associated asthma risk allele was also linked to a lower blood pressure, highlighting potential pathways shared between asthma and nephrotic syndrome.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: This SNP was associated with asthma (p<sub>meta-analysis</sub> = 2.5×10<sup>−9</sup>) and resided in <italic>PLCE1</italic>, a gene linked to an autosomal recessive nephrotic syndrome. Its association suggested potential shared pathways with atopic disorders.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: The variant rs2461864, associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), was found within a starvation-activated enhancer (Starv-Hi2-CRE) at the PLAU locus. It was strongly linked to the expression of PLAU, which encodes urokinase-type plasminogen activator, suggesting that the risk allele 'T' contributed to enhanced expression of PLAU in fibroblasts during starvation, a condition relevant to IBD pathogenesis.
title: Nutrient starvation activates ECM remodeling gene enhancers associated with inflammatory bowel disease risk in fibroblasts

finding: The SNP rs2227551, identified as a Crohn’s disease risk allele, exhibited strong positive linkage disequilibrium with rs2461864. This connection indicated that the presence of the risk allele could influence PLAU expression in fibroblasts, further implicating it in IBD risk.
title: Nutrient starvation activates ECM remodeling gene enhancers associated with inflammatory bowel disease risk in fibroblasts

finding: SNP rs2227564 was associated with increased IBD risk. Along with rs2461864, it showed positive linkage disequilibrium that suggested these variants influenced PLAU expression via the Starv-Hi2-CRE, supporting the enhanced fibroblast activation relevant to IBD.
title: Nutrient starvation activates ECM remodeling gene enhancers associated with inflammatory bowel disease risk in fibroblasts

finding: The rs2688607 variant was linked to heightened IBD risk and shared positive linkage disequilibrium with both rs2461864 and rs2227564, reinforcing its role in manipulating PLAU expression in the context of starvation and fibroblast activation.
title: Nutrient starvation activates ECM remodeling gene enhancers associated with inflammatory bowel disease risk in fibroblasts

finding: Similar to the other SNPs, rs2688608 was associated with increased IBD risk and was positively linked with rs2461864 within the Starv-Hi2-CRE. This finding supported the notion that variants at the PLAU locus collectively contributed to altered fibroblast activity linked to IBD.
title: Nutrient starvation activates ECM remodeling gene enhancers associated with inflammatory bowel disease risk in fibroblasts

finding: The SNP rs11101150 was associated with a distinct spectral signal correlated with liana-infested canopies, as reported in the study by Danner et al. (2019). The research revealed that this signal arose from multiple factors, including leaf construction and light interception characteristics in lianas, thus enhancing the understanding of genetic influences on leaf and canopy spectral properties.
title: Why can we detect lianas from space?

finding: The variant rs149014140 in the CTNNA3 gene was associated with increased TAA prevalence, having a p-value of 1.82 x 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 4.268.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs11101569 was previously associated with tumor chemoresistance in breast cancer, suggesting its role in mediating the stem-like properties of cancer cells that led to increased resistance to cytotoxic chemotherapy. This connection provided insight into how certain genetic markers could impact treatment outcomes in breast cancer patients.
title: Neutrophils exposed to a cholesterol metabolite secrete extracellular vesicles that promote epithelial-mesenchymal transition and stemness in breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs11101459 was associated with breast cancer invasion and metastasis in the context of differential association with P120 catenin isoforms, which highlighted its relevance to cancer cell behavior in response to tumor microenvironment cues.
title: Extracellular matrix guidance determines proteolytic and non-proteolytic cancer cell patterning

finding: The SNP rs11101236 was associated with genetic variations that impacted the structure parameter in the PROSPECT leaf optical properties model, which was critical for understanding the reflectance and biochemical traits of plant tissues. This finding was relevant in the context of ecological assessments, particularly those predicting relationships between leaf traits and soil nutrient components.
title: Changes in spectral signature of leaves after desiccation: Implications for the prediction of leaf traits and plant-soil interaction in herbarium samples

finding: The SNP rs11200014, located in the FGFR2 locus on chromosome 10, was identified as a known susceptibility variant associated with breast cancer. The finding was significant with a P-value of less than 5.0 × 10⁻⁸. Both MTOP and FTOP methods confirmed its association, showcasing its relevance in identifying genetic risk factors for this cancer subtype.
title: A Mixed-Model Approach for Powerful Testing of Genetic Associations with Cancer Risk Incorporating Tumor Characteristics

finding: In the 2018 study by Lorenzo-Herrero et al., the SNP rs11010029 was associated with NK cell-based immunotherapy and its effectiveness against cancer metastasis. The study pointed out that the variant influenced the immunological response mediated by NK cells, highlighting its relevance to cancer immunology and therapeutic strategies.
title: Combined CTL and NK cell cytotoxicity against cancer cells

finding: The study referenced indicated that the tumoral A genotype of the MGMT rs34180180 single-nucleotide polymorphism was associated with shorter survival in patients with aggressive gliomas. This finding highlighted the genetic variations that may influence prognosis in glioma, reinforcing the importance of genetic factors in cancer outcomes.
title: Most of transcriptional alteration in glioma result from DNA-methylation independent mechanisms

finding: The rs12416605 SNP in hsa-miR-938 had been associated with gastric cancer, with the derived T allele providing protection against the diffuse subtype of the disease.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The variant rs7089580 in the CYP2C9 gene was reported to display different allele frequencies between the Ukrainian population and their neighbors, specifically pertaining to warfarin response.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The variant rs11191548, associated with blood pressure, was a likely causal variant located in the 3'UTR of the CNNM2 gene on chromosome 10. The variant was found to be accessible in coronary arteries, as well as in R-SMCs and TP-SMCs, but not in primary SMCs.
title: Genomic, transcriptomic and proteomic depiction of iPSC-derived smooth muscle cells as emerging cellular models for arterial diseases

finding: The variant rs1800450 in the MBL2 gene was identified as particularly interesting because it altered protein structure and function. This variant had been associated with genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV, indicating its relevance in the host's response to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Functional prediction and comparative population analysis of variants in genes for proteases and innate immunity related to SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs4244285 was specified as a unique variant defining the CYP2C19*2 haplotype. It was part of a context where the haplotype needed to be distinguished from CYP2C19*35, which shared some core allele definitions. Its presence in samples was necessary to resolve the ambiguity in haplotype calls.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs12769205 was involved in defining both CYP2C19*2 and CYP2C19*35 haplotypes. This SNP was a component in the analysis to understand the callable alleles for these haplotypes within the VCF files provided to the ursaPGx package.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs3758581 contributed to the definitions of both CYP2C19*2 and CYP2C19*35 haplotypes, making it crucial in identifying callable alleles from the phased WGS data processed by ursaPGx.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs1799853 was heterozygous in the dataset and included in determining the diplotype for CYP2C9 based on its association with the CYP2C9*2 variant. Its phase with rs202201137 contributed to the final diplotype call.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs202201137 was heterozygous and played a role in defining the CYP2C9*61 haplotype when combined with rs1799853, illustrating its importance in the analysis performed by ursaPGx.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs7096169 was recognized as an eQTL for the gene AS3MT, and it was noted to be a genome-wide significant schizophrenia risk locus. Its regulatory effect was described as dynamic, displaying the greatest influence in an intermediate neuronal differentiation stage.
title: Cell-type and dynamic state govern genetic regulation of gene expression in heterogeneous differentiating cultures

finding: The study found that the mannose binding lectin gene 2 variant rs1800450 was associated with the development and severity of COVID-19 infection, indicating its potential role in influencing immune responses.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The SNP rs139222531 was identified in the gene ARID5B, which had previously established significant associations with cardiovascular disease (CVD) in the UK Biobank. The protein encoded by ARID5B is involved in inflammation and immune responses related to atherosclerosis, thus validating the effectiveness of the model used in the study.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: This SNP related to the DHX32 gene, an RNA helicase associated with leukemia, highlighting the involvement of gene regulation in cancer progression.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs11101421 was found to be associated with the impact of fibroblast-derived SPARC on the invasiveness of colorectal cancer cells. This association was derived from an analysis involving mouse models that simulate human colorectal cancer, demonstrating that variations in this SNP could correlate with tumor behavior and malignancy, suggesting its relevance in understanding disease progression in both mouse and human contexts.
title: Spatially defined multicellular functional units in colorectal cancer revealed from single cell and spatial transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs11010102 was associated with reduced tumorigenic properties in human melanoma cells when Pannexin 1 was inhibited, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in the gene's modulatory role on melanoma.
title: Pannexin 1 crosstalk with the Hippo pathway in malignant melanoma

finding: The A/G allele of SNP rs3740556 was previously noted to predict platinum-based chemotherapy resistance in lung cancer patients, highlighting its potential significance in personalized cancer treatment.
title: AsCRISPR: a web server for allele-specific sgRNA design in precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs7922007 was in very high linkage disequilibrium (r^2=1.0) with rs1800562 and was significantly associated with PV, contributing to our understanding of the role of iron metabolism in the disease.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: The rs2441727 SNP of the CTNNA3 gene had a high bio-signal (PBS = 0.32). This variant was associated with cell-cell adhesion in muscle cells and exhibited higher allele frequencies in East Asian and island Southeast Asian populations compared to other populations.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: Similar to rs2441727, the rs2660024 SNP showed a high signal (PBS = 0.32) in the context of CTNNA3, indicating its role in muscle cell adhesion and its increased frequency in East Asian and Southeast Asian populations.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: The rs1911341 SNP, also located within the CTNNA3 gene, contributed to the adaptive signatures with a high selection signal (PBS = 0.32) and was more frequently found in East Asian and Southeast Asian populations.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: The rs1911355 SNP had a high PBS value (0.32) and was indicative of the adaptive functionality of the CTNNA3 gene, showing heightened frequency in East Asian and island Southeast Asian populations.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: The SNP rs12765282 was located within a regulatory element that likely alters the binding affinity of GATA3, as the risk allele correlated with decreased GATA3 binding. This variation was tied to the 10q14 risk region, where its interactions were primarily found in ER+ breast cancer cell lines. GATA3 is critical for enhancer accessibility in estrogen receptor pathways relevant to breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: The SNP rs12244150 was associated with vegetation expansion on the Tibetan Plateau as reported by Wang et al. in 2020. The finding suggested that this genetic marker played a role in the adaptation of species to changing climatic conditions, particularly relating to the impact of climate change on vegetation dynamics in that region.
title: The distribution of Apis laboriosa revisited: range extensions and biogeographic affinities

finding: Variant rs10786689 was associated with decreased enhancer activity and thought to regulate NFKB2 and SUFU. Given its effect, the alternative allele could potentially be protective against schizophrenia.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs112049982 increased enhancer activity in primary cells but decreased activity in organoids, positively impacting the binding affinity of OLIG2, which is a marker gene for oligodendrocytes.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs2883420 was associated with increased enhancer activity when an alternative allele was present, disrupting TFBS for repressors like SRY and SOX2, suggesting a strong influence on transcriptional regulation.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The rs61841503 SNP was associated with the abundance of Peptostreptococcaceae (P=9.8×10−9), indicating genetic influences on gut microbiota composition linked to nutrient absorption and digestion.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The variant rs17537178 was associated with sulcal depth impacting the gene <italic>PTPN20</italic>. This finding contributed to understanding genomic associations with brain-related phenotypes.
title: Gene expansions contributing to human brain evolution

finding: There was a significant association between the SNP rs4539242 in the gene PYROXD2 and RBC levels of N-methyl-lysine, with a p-value of 1.90×10−63. This association confirmed previous findings in mQTL studies, indicating that metabolic signatures were strongly influenced by genetics.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs16906252 was identified as a risk factor for MGMT methylation in glioblastoma and was predictive of response to temozolomide. This finding suggested that this SNP was meaningfully associated with altered DNA methylation patterns influencing treatment outcomes.
title: Identification of DNA motifs that regulate DNA methylation

finding: The SNP rs2421701 was involved in the regulation of TNKS2 expression eQTLs, although its AD relevance was not clearly established.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs200512701 was part of eQTLs regulating TNKS2 expression, with its functional implications in AD remaining ambiguous.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs11101507 was associated with the presence of TMEM doorways in primary breast cancers and their lymph node metastases. The research illustrated how this SNP could contribute to the mechanisms through which breast cancer cells intravasate blood vessels, offering insights into its role in metastatic processes.
title: VEGF-C expressing Tumor-Associated Macrophages decrease hematogenous metastatic dissemination and normalize the tumor vasculature

finding: The variant rs3824754 was associated with systolic blood pressure (SBP) with a p-value of 1.40 x 10^-11 across all four kidney cell types examined, showing the highest deltaSVM magnitude specifically in the glomerular endothelial cell.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The variant rs284853 was part of a set of four variants (including rs284853, rs284854, rs284855, and rs284856) that demonstrated strong associations with SBP (p < 1 x 10^-4) specifically in the ENCSR000EOM group in the glomerular endothelial cell.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The variant rs284854 showed association with SBP in the same group of four variants, indicating its significance in the ENCSR000EOM analyses, with specific expression effects observed in the aorta and tibial arteries, aiding the identification of C10orf32 as a gene of interest in SBP regulation.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: Part of the grouping with rs284853, rs284855 was included in the four variants with strong SBP associations (p < 1 x 10^-4) in the ENCSR000EOM cell type, highlighting its significance in the context of SBP regulation and gene expression.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The variant rs284856 was also included in the notable set of four variants associated with SBP (p < 1 x 10^-4) in the same endothelial cell context as rs284853, rs284854, and rs284855, reinforcing its importance in the regulation of blood pressure traits.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The SNP rs7084454 was implicated in both endometriosis risk and DNA methylation differences at chromosome 10p12. It was shown to be in LD with genetic variants that are shared between endometriosis and epithelial ovarian cancer, indicating its potential role in cancer risk pathways.
title: Global Endometrial DNA Multi-omics Analysis Reveals Insights into mQTL Regulation and Associated Endometriosis Disease Risk

finding: The SNP associated with gallolysin encoding genes, specifically located in the gene gallo_rs10390. It played a crucial role in the secretion and maturation of GSP. In an experiment, a deletion mutant of gallo_rs10390/10395 was shown to lack gallocin activity, highlighting its essential function in the processing of GSP.
title: Secretion, maturation and activity of a quorum-sensing peptide (GSP) inducing bacteriocins transcription in Streptococcus gallolyticus

finding: The SNP rs2163188 was used as a proxy for rs10761785 in the analysis of educational attainment. It was positively associated with BMI in the context of its application in genetic association studies. This variant, being highly correlated with BMI, indirectly contributed to insights into body composition and its biological mechanisms.
title: Noise-augmented directional clustering of genetic association data identifies distinct mechanisms underlying obesity

finding: The in vivo studies demonstrated that the minor allele of rs80282103 associated with LARP4B gene showed a 126% increased enhancer activity in HK-2 cells, corroborating its eQTL findings linked with UACR and eGFR.
title: Mapping genomic regulation of kidney disease and traits through high-resolution and interpretable eQTLs

finding: SNP rs11446981 in GPAM showed a significant association with liver fat (p-value = 1.6e-13, beta = -0.064) and correlated with HDL cholesterol levels.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: rs75876199 was associated with the expression of the ZNF33B gene in various tissues, including significant associations with regions of the brain, indicating a potential role in the biology of suicide attempts.
title: Genome-wide copy number variation-, validation- and screening study implicates a novel copy number polymorphism associated with suicide attempts in major depressive disorder

finding: The study identified rs1890185 as a common SNP located 398bp upstream of L1#1. This SNP was found to be part of a linkage disequilibrium (LD) block, which included 72 SNPs significantly associated with various diseases, including 13 risk SNPs from 11 studies related to schizophrenia. The results suggested that rs1890185 and its LD block could play a role in regulating the expression of nearby genes, potentially influencing neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Machine learning reveals bilateral distribution of somatic L1 insertions in human neurons and glia

finding: The SNP rs7920721, which was associated with the ECHDC3 locus, was linked to LOAD-specific increased chromatin accessibility in female non-neuronal cells. This finding related to alterations in gene expression profiles, where 28 genes showed significant differential expression trends corresponding to increased chromatin accessibility near this SNP.
title: Sex dependent glial-specific changes in the chromatin accessibility landscape in late-onset Alzheimer’s disease brains

finding: The SNP rs11202929 was predicted to increase the binding affinity of multiple transcriptional activators to the ANXA11 enhancer, with protective effects against Alzheimer's disease and a positive correlation with increased expression of ANXA11.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs12412257 was linked to lower expression of ANXA11 and reduced cognitive functioning measures, indicating its association with Alzheimer's disease risk in the context of gene expression modifications.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: This SNP had a p-value of 9.07×10−11 and was located within the 5'UTR/promoter of BAG3. BAG3 is critical for preventing apoptosis and is involved in managing protein aggregates, thus linking it to neurodegenerative conditions.
title: Parkinson’s Disease Genetic Risk Evaluation in Microglia Highlights Autophagy and Lysosomal Genes

finding: SNP rs10490924, located in the ARMS2/HTRA1 locus, showed significant independent associations with both drusen area and drusen volume in subjects with early and intermediate AMD. This suggests its relevance in drusen formation.
title: Association between Drusen Burden Determined by OCT and Genetic Risk in Early and Intermediate Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The -221 MBL2 promoter variant (rs7906206) was associated with an increased risk of multiple Cryptosporidium infections, with a reported odds ratio of 4.02. This finding indicated a link between this specific SNP and the susceptibility to Cryptosporidium infections in Bangladeshi preschool children.
title: Genome-wide association study of cryptosporidiosis in infants implicates PRKCA

finding: At a naive CD4+ T cell-specific site, rs7094953 was identified as a significant caQTL (π=0.26, q=0.008).
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs7080018 was identified as one of the three intergenic variants associated with four resting-state networks (RSNs) primarily covering prefrontal regions. This finding related to the genetic basis of brain function.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: The SNP rs11596664 was found to be one of the intergenic variants linked to four RSNs mainly in the prefrontal areas, indicating its role in the genetic architecture associated with brain network activity.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: The SNP rs67221163 was associated with four RSNs primarily in the prefrontal cortex, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on resting-state brain networks.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: The SNP rs11010052 was associated with modulation of RAB7A protein expression, which determined resistance to cisplatin through late endocytic pathway impairment and extracellular vesicular secretion. This finding related to the overall chemoresistance observed in ovarian cancer cells.
title: Chemo-sEVs release in cisplatin-resistance ovarian cancer cells are regulated by the lysosomal function

finding: This SNP was associated with the tract connecting the left and right precuneus, showing a z-score of -5.58, contributing to the tract-wise connectivity analysis.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: There was a positive association found between CYP2C19 activity scores inferred from the genotype of rs12248560 and the volume of basal ganglia and hippocampus. This effect was observed only in female individuals, suggesting a potential link to estrogen steroid metabolism.
title: Genetic polymorphism of CYP2C19 and subcortical variability in the human adult brain

finding: The SNP rs11101608 was previously identified as a significant marker in ovarian cancer research, specifically linked to the immune response and cancer cell interactions. The study highlighted that variations in this locus could influence the expression levels of IL20RA and its related immune signaling pathways, affecting the cancer survival and metastatic potential in ovarian cancer patients.
title: A systematic CRISPR screen reveals an IL-20/IL20RA-mediated peritoneal immune crosstalk to prevent the ovarian cancer metastasis

finding: The study by Vydra et al. (2019) revealed that SNP rs11101533 played a crucial role in the activation of HSF1 via MAPK signaling in estrogen receptor-alpha positive breast cancer cells. This finding connected the SNP to critical signaling pathways involved in breast cancer cell regulation.
title: Single-cell transcription mapping of murine and human mammary organoids responses to female hormones

finding: The SNP rs10510126 was identified as having a recessive model according to the proposed method, whereas previous methods such as HWET-C suggested an additive model. This finding related to breast cancer risk, highlighting the inconsistency in genetic models for this SNP.
title: Estimating genetic inheritance in case-control studies

finding: For SNP rs2420946, the proposed method suggested a novel genetic model value of 0.38, which is beyond the commonly employed models. This was relevant in assessing genetic risks in breast cancer.
title: Estimating genetic inheritance in case-control studies

finding: The SNP rs1917799, located in the DNA repair gene ERCC6, was found to be associated with an increased risk of gastric cancer in the Chinese population.
title: FINDEL: A Deep Learning Approach to Efficient Artifact Removal From Cancer Genomes

finding: Similar to rs6670984, the strand orientation was corrected for this SNP, which highlights the importance of accurate strand mapping in genotyping studies.
title: The FORCE panel: An all-in-one SNP marker set for confirming investigative genetic genealogy leads and for general forensic applications

finding: The SNP rs41298373, a coding polymorphism in the gene ITIH5, was significantly associated with increased leftward asymmetry of PT volume (p=2.01×10^-15). It was identified as deleterious and showed specific association with left-sided PT volume rather than right-sided volume. This finding provided insights into genetic influences on brain asymmetry.
title: Genetic effects on planum temporale asymmetry and their limited relevance to neurodevelopmental disorders, intelligence or educational attainment

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes. This finding related specifically to the modulation of incretin action, highlighting the significance of this SNP in metabolic conditions and its potential implications in understanding diabetes pathogenesis.
title: Single cell atlas of domestic pig brain illuminates the conservation and divergence of cell types at spatial and species levels

finding: The genetic variant rs3118471-G within the IL2RA gene was associated with reduced lymphocyte side scatter traits and an increased risk for multiple sclerosis (MS). The association was characterized as supporting IL2RA as a therapeutic target for MS treatment, with implications for the modulation of immune response.
title: Genetic Analyses of Blood Cell Structure for Biological and Pharmacological Inference

finding: The study found that the derived and protective allele of the TCF7L2 variant rs10885409 exhibited a geographic pattern of lower frequencies in South and West Asia compared to East Asian populations. This suggests that the derived alleles of this SNP might confer a selective advantage based on dietary variation, particularly in relation to vitamin A.
title: Reconstruction of nine thousand years of agriculture-based diet and impact on human genetic diversity in Asia

finding: The SNP rs2230394 was identified as correlated with type 2 diabetes, as noted in the study of Itgb1 gene polymorphism in human subjects.
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq of Heart Reveals Intercellular Communication Drivers of Myocardial Fibrosis in Diabetic Mice

finding: The SNP rs2230395 was correlated with type 2 diabetes and was specifically pointed out for causing a termination of translation (Tyr153=>(Ter)). This significant correlation was established in a GWAS context.
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq of Heart Reveals Intercellular Communication Drivers of Myocardial Fibrosis in Diabetic Mice

finding: The SNP rs16933819 was linked to type 2 diabetes among other SNPs in the Itgb1 gene analyzed in the study.
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq of Heart Reveals Intercellular Communication Drivers of Myocardial Fibrosis in Diabetic Mice

finding: The SNP rs12217769 was linked to macular thickness and was associated with eye-related traits, although the functional role of the LRIT2 gene was not characterized at the time of the analysis.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The SNP rs745480 was associated with refractive error in humans, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing eye morphology and function linked to LRIT2.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The study reported that the GAD65 promoter polymorphism rs2236418 modulated harm avoidance behavior in women through an altered inhibition/excitation balance in the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC). This emphasized the role of GABA-related genetic variations in influencing anxiety-related phenotypes.
title: Sex differences in anxiety and threat avoidance in GAD65 knock-out mice

finding: This SNP in GPAM was found to be associated with liver fat accumulation and metabolic traits related to lipid metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The SNP rs10823108 was identified as being responsible for genetic susceptibility to diabetic nephropathy. This finding was significant as it highlighted the role of SIRT1 in diabetes-related complications, establishing a link between this genetic variant and the severity of symptoms in patients suffering from metabolic disorders.
title: A natural genetic variation screen identifies insulin signaling, neuronal communication, and innate immunity as modifiers of hyperglycemia in the absence of Sirt1

finding: This SNP was classified as a primary shared signal at the TCF7L2 locus, with TOA scores of 0.31 in islet and 0.37 in adipose tissue, indicating its involvement in T2D risk.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: This SNP was classified as an islet signal at the CDC123-CAMK1D locus, known to colocalize with CAMK1D eQTL expression in human islet cells.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: A significant finding was reported for SNP rs2249695 in the CYP2E1 gene. Patients with at least one copy of the reference allele generally responded better to roflumilast and fluticasone co-treatment. Specifically, the inhibition of TNFα release was 77.6% in homozygous reference genotype (TT) compared to 50.74% in homozygous alternative genotype (CC), with a statistically significant difference (p = 0.02).
title: Application of Pharmacogenomics and Bioinformatics to Exemplify the Utility of Human ex vivo Organoculture Models in the Field of Precision Medicine

finding: The SNP rs11101422 was identified as a significant variant related to the autophagy pathway, specifically in the context of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) integrity during muscle regeneration. The finding indicated that this SNP might influence the efficiency of autophagy mechanisms that selectively target and remove mutation-bearing mtDNA, thereby playing a role in maintaining cellular fitness and could have implications for mtDNA-related diseases and ageing.
title: Mitochondrial membrane proteins and VPS35 orchestrate selective removal of mtDNA

finding: The human syntenous variant rs769896655, corresponding to the mouse Cdh23 c.753G>A allele, demonstrated nominally significant enrichment of the A allele in individuals with schizophrenia, particularly in the Japanese population. Although the variant did not show association in pooled analyses due to its rarity in other populations, it remained in considerable linkage disequilibrium with PPI-associated variants, suggesting a potential role in schizophrenia susceptibility.
title: Role of an atypical cadherin gene, Cdh23 in prepulse inhibition and its implication in schizophrenia

finding: The study highlighted the rs7903146 SNP's association with diabetic nephropathy, noting that this association was influenced by concomitant type 2 diabetes. This was investigated within a South Indian population, establishing a genetic link relevant to metabolic diseases.
title: Potpourri: An Epistasis Test Prioritization Algorithm via Diverse SNP Selection

finding: In the context of bipolar disorder, the rs11013860 polymorphism within the CACNB2 gene was found to correlate with prefrontal cortex thickness in patients experiencing first-episode mania. This suggests a significant association between this SNP and neuroanatomical alterations pertinent to the disorder.
title: Altered astrocytic and microglial homeostasis characterizes a decreased proinflammatory state in bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), residing in an enhancer of the IPMK gene with a p-value of 1.0 × 10^-6.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with IBD, located in intron 1 of the IPMK gene, with a p-value of 8.0 × 10^-9.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This SNP was associated with IBD, found in intron 4 of the IPMK gene, with a p-value of 2.0 × 10^-11 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.40.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This intergenic variant was associated with IBD, with a p-value of 5.0 × 10^-11 and a MAF of 0.40.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs11010059 was identified in a study that examined the spectrum of Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition (EMT) phenotypes in circulating tumor cells from early breast cancer patients. This finding indicated a correlation between the SNP and varying EMT statuses, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus may influence the aggressiveness of cancer through modulating EMT processes.
title: Comparative study of transcriptomics-based scoring metrics for the epithelial-hybrid-mesenchymal spectrum

finding: The analysis involving rs2981579 was part of the targeted investigation on breast cancer risk variants, confirming its relevance within the FGFR2 gene vicinity.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP was discovered as a newly identified association in the investigation of FGFR2 related to breast cancer risk.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was previously documented for its association with breast cancer in various populations, thus reinforcing its significance.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was part of a meta-analysis confirming its association with breast cancer susceptibility, reinforcing previous findings.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs11446981 was linked to liver fat (p=1.6e-13, beta=-0.064) and colocalizes with AST and HDL cholesterol levels, indicating it may influence fat accumulation in the liver.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs11101618 was identified as having a significant association with the MAPK signaling pathway, which has been implicated in various cancers. This finding was originally reported in the context of its potential role as a therapeutic target in cancer treatments, highlighting its relevance in oncogenic processes.
title: Intrinsically disordered membrane anchors of Rheb, RhoA and DiRas3 small GTPases: Molecular dynamics, membrane organization, and interactions

finding: The rs35837782 SNP was located in an intronic open chromatin region of the LHPP gene, which was identified as a cis-regulatory element (cCRE) associated with transcription factors implicated in B-cell differentiation and showed increased expression in pro-B and pre-B cells in the context of BCP ALL.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: In EBV+ Ramos cells, rs1250567 located in the ZMIZ1 locus exhibited strong EBNA2 allele-dependent binding. This variant was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) and showed a chromatin looping interaction with the promoter of the short isoform of ZMIZ1. The expression levels of ZMIZ1 were three-fold lower in EBV+ Ramos cells compared to uninfected cells, which aligned with previous findings of decreased ZMIZ1 protein expression in MS patient blood samples.
title: Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 (EBNA2) extensively rewires the human chromatin landscape at autoimmune risk loci

finding: Located at the JCAD/KIAA1462 locus, this variant was also found in endothelial cell peaks and was prioritized as a functional CAD risk variant.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: This variant at the LIPA locus was linked to macrophage-targeted regulatory networks signifying its involvement in CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: In the context of the IBD risk locus at chromosome 10q22.3, the variant rs1250566 was noted to overlap an enhancer active in several immune cell types. Although located in an intron of the gene ZMIZ1, the ABC Model predicted that rs1250566 regulated the nearby gene PPIF instead. This was attributed to the variant being in closer 3D contact with the promoter of PPIF, suggesting its significant regulatory role despite being classified within ZMIZ1.
title: Genome-wide maps of enhancer regulation connect risk variants to disease genes

finding: The SNP rs10510126 was associated with breast cancer and identified in a study by Hunter et al. (2007). The proposed method indicated that this SNP had a recessive genetic model, contrasting with the HWET-C method which suggested an additive model.
title: Estimating genetic inheritance in case-control studies

finding: The SNP rs2420946 was associated with breast cancer from the study by Hunter et al. (2007). The proposed method revealed a unique genetic model yielding a value of 0.38, which extended beyond the commonly utilized genetic models.
title: Estimating genetic inheritance in case-control studies

finding: The analysis identified a missense variant rs140790046 within the MKX locus, which caused a p.Asn309Ser change. This variant was found in an AD case and contributed to understanding recessive variants in AD.
title: Autosomal Recessive Alzheimer’s disease (arAD): homozygosity mapping of genomic regions containing arAD loci

finding: The SNP rs9664184 was implicated as a shared eQTL/pQTL for the gene MYOZ1, suggesting that it influenced both mRNA and protein abundances, although the specific association with AF was not described.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: In studies by Flis et al., the SNP rs11101544 was identified as having a significant role in the treatment response in chronic myeloid leukemia (CML). Specifically, the investigation showed that simultaneous inhibition of BCR-ABL1 and PAK1/2 kinases, where this SNP was implicated, exerted a synergistic cytotoxic effect on leukemia cells, indicating its importance in therapeutic strategies.
title: NSC348884 cytotoxicity is not mediated by inhibition of nucleophosmin oligomerization

finding: The T2D-risk allele (G) at rs703972 was found to be associated with significantly lower insulin content in islets when compared to noncarriers. Additionally, insulin secretion in response to high glucose (16.7 mM) was also reduced in carriers, indicating impaired beta-cell function.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: Carriers of the T2D-risk allele (A) at rs12571751 also exhibited significantly reduced insulin content and impaired insulin secretion at high glucose concentrations. This finding corroborated the association of rs12571751 with gene expression at the ZMIZ1 locus.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: The homologous variant c.753G>A (rs769896655) in the CDH23 gene was found to be significantly enriched in individuals diagnosed with schizophrenia, particularly noted within the Japanese population where the A allele was overrepresented compared to controls (p=0.045). This variant underscores a potential involvement of CDH23 in schizophrenia susceptibility, although its rarity in other populations posed challenges for broader genome-wide association studies.
title: Role of an Atypical Cadherin Gene, Cdh23 in Prepulse Inhibition and Implication of CDH23 in Schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs11189671, located about 70bp from the identified ZNF274 motif, was associated with an increased risk of schizophrenia. Its dosage correlated with the expression of multiple PCDH genes in the adult frontal cortex, indicating its involvement in regulating gene expression related to schizophrenia risk.
title: Clusters of lineage-specific genes are anchored by ZNF274 in repressive perinucleolar compartments

finding: This variant was shown to affect BAG3 levels through its association with the BAG3-HSP70-HSPB complex, emphasizing its relevance for heart failure biomarkers.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: This missense variant in SFTPD colocalized with a COVID-19 hospitalization association, free from interactions with expression in other conditions.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs1005277 was identified as the only variant associated with the Hannum-based epigenetic age acceleration (Hannum-EAA), implicating 12 genes related to innate immune system pathways and showing evidence of eQTL effects on expression of several zinc finger proteins involved in transcriptional regulation.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The SNP rs1663689 was found to repress the gene ADGRG6 through interchromosomal interactions. This repression was associated with a reduction in lung cancer progression, indicating that the SNP plays a critical role in the molecular mechanisms leading to cancer development.
title: Interchromosomal Colocalization with Parental Genes Is Linked to the Function and Evolution of Mammalian Retrocopies

finding: The SNP rs11101552 was associated with a significant finding in the study that connected ligand-independent EGFR activation with ErbB3 phosphorylation. This finding was important as it highlighted a mechanism of cancer cell proliferation and resistance to the treatment with cetuximab. The study indicated that the aberrant activation of the EGF receptors could play a role in cancer biology, thus implicating this SNP in relevant pathways affecting cancer progression.
title: Inhibition of EGFR/ErbB does not protect against C. difficile toxin B

finding: The variant rs7922621 was identified as an AD risk locus located within a microglia-specific CRE that regulates the expression of genes ANXA11 and TSPAN14. The presence of the A allele was shown to decrease accessibility of the CRE, impacting gene expression and impairing microglial phagocytosis.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: The variant rs2573353 was characterized within the context of ANXA11 regulation influenced by rs7922621. The allelic balance changes in rs7922621 indicated a difference in ANXA11 expression linked to microglial functionality and AD pathology.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: The study identified rs7903146 as the largest-effect common variant signal for Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) in Europeans, highlighting its crucial role within the TCF7L2 locus. It explained a significant amount of genetic variance and was associated with regulatory elements affecting TCF7L2 expression.
title: Evaluation of Bayesian Linear Regression Models as a Fine Mapping tool

finding: rs34855922 was identified as another associated SNP for T2D within the TCF7L2 locus. Its identification alongside rs7903146 provided additional evidence of multiple genetic signals at the locus, demonstrating the effectiveness of the BayesR model in revealing these associations.
title: Evaluation of Bayesian Linear Regression Models as a Fine Mapping tool

finding: An intronic variant, rs145034729, was identified at the TCF7L2 locus. While its effect was uncertain, it was suggested that it may act as an enhancer element, potentially modulating the expression of distal genes related to T2D, contributing to the complex regulatory framework at the locus.
title: Evaluation of Bayesian Linear Regression Models as a Fine Mapping tool

finding: The SNP rs7912495 was identified as the lead QTL SNP associated with the USP6NL gene across all four brain regions studied. It was linked to Alzheimer's disease risk, with the significant expression increase of USP6NL mediated through this SNP (β = -0.0492; P = 6.8×10^-10). The meta-analysis showed high posterior probability of colocalization with ECHDC3 in AD GWAS datasets.
title: Atlas of genetic effects in human microglia transcriptome across brain regions, aging and disease pathologies

finding: The SNP rs7920721 was the lead GWAS SNP within the ECHDC3 locus, which is associated with Alzheimer's disease. This SNP shares linkage disequilibrium with rs7912495 and was involved in fine-mapping analyses indicating a potential risk connection.
title: Atlas of genetic effects in human microglia transcriptome across brain regions, aging and disease pathologies

finding: The variant rs7903146 was associated with body mass index (BMI) and type 2 diabetes (T2D). Specifically, the effect estimate for BMI was -0.016 with a p-value of 1.4 x 10^-14, indicating a significant negative association, while for T2D, it had an effect estimate of 0.319 with a remarkably low p-value of 1.7 x 10^-204, suggesting a strong positive association. This SNP was noted to be a well-known risk factor associated with T2D and was identified as a BMI-associated hit in the GIANT consortium.
title: A Hierarchical Approach Using Marginal Summary Statistics for Multiple Intermediates in a Mendelian Randomization or Transcriptome Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11101618 was associated with the MAPK pathway, which is a recognized therapeutic target in cancer. This association underscored the relevance of signaling pathways in cancer therapies, consistent with findings from the referenced study by Braicu et al. (2019), highlighting its potential role in modifying disease outcomes.
title: Designing peptide drug with archaeal antimicrobial peptides against multidrug resistant bacterial biofilms and human diseases: an in silico approach

finding: Linked to type 2 diabetes, rs11257655 was reported in the CDC123 regulatory region and showed ASB involving several transcription factors, including FOXA1 and ESR1. FOXA1 is known to be involved in glucose homeostasis, and polymorphisms in ESR1 are associated with type 2 diabetes.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs3824662, located in an enhancer element associated with GATA3, was found to have a strong positive association with Philadelphia chromosome-like acute lymphoblastic leukemia (Ph-like ALL). The risk allele 'A' was shown to significantly increase enhancer activity, enhancing GATA3 transcription by creating a chromatin loop to the CRLF2 promoter. This allele was also linked to increased chromatin accessibility and was instrumental in altering global gene expression patterns associated with leukemia.
title: Non-coding germline GATA3 variants alter chromatin topology and contribute to pathogenesis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The rs12777823 SNP in CYP2C9 was associated with a decreased warfarin dose requirement specifically in African Americans, highlighting the importance of studying genetic variations within minority populations to understand their unique pharmacogenomic profiles.
title: Uncovering the role admixture in health disparities: Assocication of hepatocyte gene expression and DNA methylation to African Ancestry in African-Americans

finding: Identified as significant in relation to type 2 diabetes, this SNP's association supports its importance in metabolic conditions.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was shown to be significant in relation to type 2 diabetes, illustrating its metabolic implications.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The polymorphism rs12779790 in CDC123/CAMK1D gene was associated with gestational diabetes mellitus in women, highlighting its relevance in understanding the genetic predisposition to GDM.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: Linked to ASM in the CAMK2G gene and identified as a GWAS peak SNP for psoriasis and Type 2 diabetes; it disrupts JUNB binding motifs associated with T cell regulation.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Linked to breast cancer via strong LD and exhibited functional effects through specific TF motif alterations.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Showed significant correlation with breast cancer and exhibited ASM interactions affecting transcriptional regulation.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs11010119 was associated with platinum resistance in ovarian cancer as demonstrated in a study by Damia and Broggini. This finding was particularly relevant to the context of DNA repair mechanisms in high-grade serous carcinoma (HGSC) and suggested a linkage between genetic factors and the efficacy of platinum-based therapies.
title: Coordinated protein modules define DNA damage responses to carboplatin at single cell resolution in human ovarian carcinoma models

finding: Despite being less well characterized in the context of schizophrenia, this SNP was associated with elite sprinter status, showcasing its potential roles in performance and physical traits.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The SNP rs17094222 in HIF1AN was found to be associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in a Genome-Wide Association Study, indicating its potential role in obesity mechanisms through interaction with pathways regulating adipogenic processes.
title: Regulatory Modules of Human Thermogenic Adipocytes: Functional Genomics of Meta-Analyses Derived Marker-Genes

finding: The SNP rs11010068 was linked to improved delivery strategies for targeted tumor treatment. This research contributed valuable insights into methodologies that boosted treatment efficiency for cancer therapies, particularly in the context of targeted therapy development.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: The study found a positive association between the activity scores inferred from the CYP2C19 genotype (including rs12248560) and the volume of basal ganglia and hippocampus. This association was specific to female individuals, suggesting a potential link between CYP2C19 metabolism and brain morphology through estrogen-related mechanisms.
title: Genetic polymorphism of CYP2C19 and subcortical variability in the human adult brain

finding: The SNP rs10883761 was identified as disrupting potential binding sites for transcription factors, which indicated its role in affecting enhancer functionality, specifically in the context of neurodevelopmental diseases.
title: Bridging between mouse and human enhancer-promoter long-range interactions in neural stem cells, to understand enhancer function in neurodevelopmental disease

finding: The SNP rs7907645 was noted for leading to the acquisition of potential novel transcription factor binding sites, suggesting a possible gain of function that could influence neurodevelopmental disease pathways.
title: Bridging between mouse and human enhancer-promoter long-range interactions in neural stem cells, to understand enhancer function in neurodevelopmental disease

finding: The SNP rs1663689 was associated with the repression of the ADGRG6 gene through interchromosomal interactions. This repression was noted to correlate with a reduction in lung cancer progression, indicating a significant impact of this noncoding SNP on cancer biology.
title: Interchromosomal Colocalization with Parental Genes Is Linked to the Function and Evolution of Mammalian Retrocopies

finding: This SNP had significant contacts with TSPAN14, suggesting its importance in elucidating mechanisms of AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs11010092 was associated with traits influencing the vertical foraging niche of mammals and birds, showing correlations with diet and body mass. Specifically, there was a significant connection with the presence of fruit in diets which related to higher foraging positions in the canopy, aligning with the resource-driven vertical niche partitioning theory. This finding had geographical relevance, highlighting hotspots in regions like the Andes-Amazon transition zone, indicative of ecological specialization driven by evolutionary adaptations in response to vertical resource gradients.
title: Functional traits and phylogeny predict vertical foraging in terrestrial mammals and birds

finding: The SNP rs11202929 was shown to be protective against Alzheimer's disease. It appeared to enhance binding affinity of twelve activator transcription factors to the enhancer region of the ANXA11 gene in resident CNS macrophages.
title: NetREm Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: SNP rs12412257 was correlated with reduced ANXA11 expression, which was associated with diminished fluid intelligence and reasoning abilities, indicating its significance in cognitive function and Alzheimer's risk.
title: NetREm Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs2243639, related to surfactant protein D, was linked to COPD susceptibility and demonstrated differences among healthy smokers and non-smokers.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The deletion of a 37 bp sequence surrounding rs725861 decreased GATA3 expression in Th2 cells from two different donors. This indicated that this distal sequence functions as an enhancer in Th2 cells, implicating that risk variants for asthma and allergic diseases likely affect GATA3 expression in this cell type.
title: Deletion mapping of regulatory elements for GATA3 reveals a distal T helper 2 cell enhancer involved in allergic diseases

finding: The SNP rs4746023 was identified as having an eQTL in RGC1 cell types, where each additional copy of the A allele in patients with POAG caused an average increase of 1.4 transcripts per cell, which was approximately two times higher than in healthy controls.
title: Retinal ganglion cell-specific genetic regulation in primary open angle glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs11200014 was identified as a known susceptibility variant in the FGFR2 locus on chromosome 10, with a significant association found through the MTOP method yielding a p-value less than 5 × 10^-8. This finding contributed to understanding risk in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: A mixed-model approach for powerful testing of genetic associations with cancer risk incorporating tumor characteristics

finding: The rs7085433 variant in the TIMM23 gene was connected to time trial performance. This gene is essential for mitochondrial protein transport. The variant's effect size indicated slower completion times, impairing exercise potential.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The rs2234962 variant was noted as a significant novel locus for DCM risk, with P<5×10^-54, correlating with the Q-R upslope at −18ms from the R wave, and associated with the BAG3 gene.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: The SNP rs12264666, within the gene KIAA1217, demonstrated a higher frequency of the ancestral allele in South West coast and North West Indian groups relative to the Gangetic plain, indicating a unique genetic history consistent with long-term coastal food habits.
title: Genetic affinities and adaptation of the South West coast populations of India

finding: On 10p12.31, rs946711 demonstrated a z-score of -5.58 associated with edge connectivity of the precuneus, indicating its relevance in the structural brain network.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs73310256 in HTR7 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). Its relevance to AD was highlighted as part of the broader context of identifying novel targets via the GuiltyTargets approach.
title: GuiltyTargets: Prioritization of Novel Therapeutic Targets with Deep Network Representation Learning

finding: The SNP rs11101618 was originally found to be associated with a significant therapeutic target in cancer, particularly related to MAPK pathways, according to the findings reported by Braicu et al. in their 2019 comprehensive review. This finding highlighted the relevance of this SNP in understanding cancer treatment and development.
title: In silico design of bioactive chimeric peptide from archaeal antimicrobial peptides

finding: The SNP rs11101507 was positively linked to the vascular endothelial growth factor C (VEGF-C) signaling pathway in the context of breast cancer, correlating with the normalization of tumor blood vessels and its paradoxical role in metastasis to lymph nodes.
title: VEGF-C expressing Tumor-Associated Macrophages decrease hematogenous metastatic dissemination and normalize the tumor vasculature

finding: SNP rs4962419 was identified in both scenarios of analysis, indicating its potential role in affecting transcription factor binding and protein-protein interactions within prostate cancer-associated enhancer-promoter interaction networks.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: This SNP had been shown in previous investigations to be associated with increasing adenoma count at colonoscopy, a significant marker for colorectal cancer risk.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: The intronic variant rs1171614 of SLC16A9 was included among the putative core instruments for serum urate levels. The analyses indicated that higher serum urate levels were associated with an elevated risk of gout.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The SNP rs73349121 was identified in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) of mitochondrial DNA copy number (mtDNA-CN) conducted in over 450,000 individuals of White (European) ancestry. In a subsequent analysis involving a smaller cohort of 4,770 individuals of Black ancestry, rs73349121 showed a statistically significant association (p = 0.0001) with mtDNA-CN, indicating consistent genetic effects across different ancestry groups. This suggests that SNP rs73349121 may play a role in modulating mtDNA-CN, which is related to mitochondrial function and has implications for aging-related diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of mitochondrial DNA copy number reveals multiple loci implicated in nucleotide metabolism, platelet activation, and megakaryocyte proliferation

finding: An intronic variant in IL2RA that was linked to downregulation of IL2RA and upregulation of nearby genes IL15RA and RBM17, relevant for T cell proliferation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: Associated with RBPJ expression, a gene involved in WNT signaling in T cells, potentially influencing T cell behavior.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The loci rs12412241 on chromosome 10 showed strong associations with obesity-related conditions such as hypertension, with a p-value of <1×10^-4.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNV rs1799853 was identified as a causative variant for the CYP2C9*2 haplotype. It was observed at frequencies ranging from 8-15% in European and admixed American populations, indicating its significant prevalence and potentially impacting drug metabolism.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: rs41291556 was the causative variant for the CYP2C19*8 haplotype and had a frequency of 1.5% in Central Europeans, indicating a notable archaic influence on drug metabolism in certain populations.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: The promoter polymorphism rs12770170 (−184C/T) of Microseminoprotein, Beta was identified as a risk factor for benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) specifically in a Korean population. This finding was significant as it related to the prevalence and genetic predisposition of BPH within this demographic context.
title: TIAM1 signaling drives prostatic budding and branching phenotypes and is a potential therapeutic target for BPH

finding: The SNP rs12722502 was identified as a lymphocyte count-associated variant located within the intronic region of IL2RA. It co-localised with a DNase footprint and enhancer RNA (eRNA), indicating its potential functional significance in immune cell regulation. The analysis showed that this variant caused a predicted reduction in binding of ETS family transcription factors by five-fold, suggesting it plays a critical role in modulating immune functions.
title: DNA-binding factor footprints and enhancer RNAs identify functional non-coding genetic variants

finding: SNP rs2274224, an exonic SNP in PLCCE1:PLCE1-AS1 on chromosome 10, showed a significant increase in interhemispheric connectivity for minor allele carriers (C, MAF = 0.44) relative to non-carriers.
title: Imaging genetics of language network functional connectivity reveals links with language-related abilities, dyslexia and handedness

finding: The study analyzed the FGFR2 gene SNP rs2981579, demonstrating that associations concerning it were reinforced by the DOT method.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Found to be a new association within FGFR2, rs2981427 showed significance in breast cancer risk assessment.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Associated with breast cancer risk, rs1219648 within FGFR2 showcased significant findings in prior literature, reaffirmed here.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP, part of FGFR2, demonstrated its association with breast cancer in several studies, further supported by new evidence.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs2234962 was identified as a significant marker associated with DCM through its strong linkage disequilibrium with rs61869036, supporting its inclusion in the genetic risk score.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: The SNP rs61869036 was associated with DCM (p = 4.7 × 10<sup>−14</sup>), being well-established as a genetic contributor to the disorder.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: Rs2506030 was previously characterized as a RET enhancer variant associated with HSCR risk, demonstrating significant enhancer activity and contributing to the overall regulatory landscape of RET.
title: A multi-enhancer RET regulatory code is disrupted in Hirschsprung disease

finding: This SNP was identified as a RET enhancer with established associations with HSCR risk, showing significant allelic differences in enhancer activity.
title: A multi-enhancer RET regulatory code is disrupted in Hirschsprung disease

finding: Rs2435357 was demonstrated to function as a RET enhancer variant linked to HSCR, showing differential expression effects when allele types were compared.
title: A multi-enhancer RET regulatory code is disrupted in Hirschsprung disease

finding: The SNP rs701873 showed a significant association with nightmare frequency, with a p-value of 2.18e-8. This finding suggested unique genetic risk factors for nightmares, as the variant was intronic to the MYOF gene, which is expressed in microglia in the brain. The analysis emphasized that this signal persisted even after controlling for individuals with heavy alcohol usage.
title: Nightmares share strong genetic risk with sleep and psychiatric disorders

finding: Variant rs1902660 was analyzed as an eQTL that exhibited higher expression of TSPAN14, which was putatively causal for Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This analysis highlighted the potential role of non-coding mutations in AD pathogenesis.
title: EMO: Predicting Non-coding Mutation-induced Up- and Down-regulation of Risk Gene Expression using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs7916271 was found to disrupt KLF16 binding motifs. This disruption was relevant to the age-specific cortex (ASC) gene signatures connected to neuropsychiatric disorders, highlighting its potential role in the regulatory relationships between ASC genes and disease genes.
title: Age-specific gene signatures underlying the transcriptomes and functional connectomes of human cerebral cortex

finding: The variant rs12722502 was identified as an intronic variant of IL2RA co-localizing with a DNase footprint and eRNA, indicating its involvement in the regulation of immune cell function. It was predicted to cause a significant reduction in ETF family transcription factor binding, specifically leading to a five-fold reduction in ELF1 binding in human leukemic T-cells.
title: DNA-binding factor footprints and enhancer RNAs identify functional non-coding genetic variants

finding: This SNP was shown to affect transcription factor binding motifs for retinoic acid receptors, revealing its role in retinoid-mediated transcriptional regulation.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: This SNP altered RARA motifs, indicating its role as a functional SNP within the context of retinoid transcription factors in MDD.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The SNP rs11101507 was associated with TMEM doorways being restricted to blood vessel endothelium in both primary breast cancers and their lymph node metastases. This finding underscored the significant role of this SNP in mediating the interaction between tumor cells and the microenvironment facilitating metastasis.
title: VEGF-C expressing Tumor Associated Macrophages decrease hematogenous metastatic dissemination and normalizes the tumor vasculature

finding: The SNP rs17731, at chr10:3,821,561, was found within an exon of the KLF6 gene, which is involved in transcription factor activity and neurite growth. Similar to rs1054972, its case-control effect sizes suggested an association with schizophrenia, but significance was not achieved in prior studies. The gene KLF6 had not been previously associated to schizophrenia at the time of this analysis.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: The SNP rs11101439 was associated with alterations in splicing machinery in the context of neuroendocrine tumors, particularly highlighting its relevance to the aggressiveness of tumors. The study provided evidence linking this SNP to spliceosomic profiles affecting clinical outcomes and signaling pathways, specifically citing its involvement in tumor differentiation and the molecular characteristics of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors.
title: An integrative RNA spliceosomic landscape of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors unveils novel clinicomolecular associations

finding: The SNP rs11101514 was identified as a predictive marker for response and outcome in patients with advanced lung adenocarcinoma receiving chemotherapy, specifically indicating that KRAS mutations may affect treatment efficacy.
title: Bioinformatic Analysis Linking Genomic Defects to Chemosensitivity and Mechanism of Action

finding: The SNP rs7903146 in the TCF7L2 gene was associated with diabetic nephropathy, highlighting its role in the context of type 2 diabetes. The study involved a population from South India and also included a meta-analysis, demonstrating the complexity of its relationship with the phenotype.
title: Potpourri: An Epistasis Test Prioritization Algorithm via Diverse SNP Selection
