finding: The study by Colic et al. (2018) provided evidence that the GAD65 promoter polymorphism rs2236418 modulated harm avoidance in women. This modulation was linked to the balance of inhibition and excitation within the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), suggesting a potential genetic influence on anxiety-related behaviors.
title: Sex differences in anxiety and threat avoidance in GAD65 knock-out mice

finding: The SNP rs11187837 was significantly associated with amplitude traits in various brain regions, particularly in the 10q23.33 genomic region, indicating its influence on intrinsic brain activity related to cognitive functions.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: Found within the 10q26.3 genomic region, rs10781575 exhibited significant associations with amplitude traits that are linked to brain functional connectivity.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: This SNP was prioritized among LD-linked variants, outperforming GWAS SNP rs1042058 in the context of its associated phenotype.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The SNP rs10510126 was identified as having a recessive genetic model in conjunction with the proposed method for breast cancer analysis, whereas it was assessed as additive using the HWET-C method.
title: Estimating Genetic Inheritance in Case-control Studies

finding: The SNP rs2420946 revealed an alternative genetic model of 0.38 when analyzed using the proposed method, indicating it can define models beyond the commonly used three.
title: Estimating Genetic Inheritance in Case-control Studies

finding: This SNP was associated with a leftward shift of surface area asymmetry in two lateral temporal regions, a rightward shift in two medial temporal regions, and a leftward shift in cortical thickness asymmetry in the inferior temporal gyrus, contributing significantly to brain asymmetry.
title: The genetic architecture of structural left-right asymmetry of the human brain

finding: It was found that the polymorphism rs17095355 in the X-prolyl aminopeptidase 1 gene was associated with biliary atresia in Thai children, contributing to the understanding of genetic susceptibility related to this disease.
title: Efemp1 modulates elastic fiber formation and mechanics of the extrahepatic bile duct

finding: SNP rs117885390, while showing a lower association strength with schizophrenia (SCZ), was identified as a positive finding. It was situated in an enhancer region of the ITGB1 gene, which is actively regulated in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and has been shown to potentially play a role in the development of SCZ.
title: Convolutional neural network model to predict causal risk factors that share complex regulatory features

finding: Targeting this SNP in the <italic>CNNM2</italic> locus led to a strong transcriptional signature related to senescence despite no differential expression for nearby genes.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: The risk allele displayed significantly lower transcriptional activity relative to the normal allele in LNCaP cells, which suggested a negative regulation on gene expression.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The association signal for TL on chromosome 10, represented by rs9420907, co-localized with an eQTL affecting expression of STN1 in seven tissue types, including skin (sun exposed), transverse colon, and EM. This finding suggested that this SNP also plays a role in influencing TL by regulating the expression of genes that are known to be involved in telomere maintenance.
title: Determinants of telomere length across human tissues

finding: The rs7903146 SNP in the TCF7L2 gene was identified as the most significant locus for type 2 diabetes (T2D) with a p-value of 7.288 × 10^-13, consistent with findings from previous studies in diverse populations, including sub-Saharan Africans.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The SNP rs1335540 was found to be highly linked (r2 > 0.85) to the top transcription factor-eQTL (TF-eQTL) interactions for the APBB1IP gene. It is located 15 bases upstream of the APBB1IP transcript start site and overlaps an IKZF1 ChIP-seq peak, matching an IKZF1 binding motif. The study indicated that the expression of APBB1IP, regulated by the transcription factor IKZF1, was associated with blood cell traits, providing a mechanism through which genetic variants could influence these traits via the neuroendocrine system.
title: Transcription factor regulation of eQTL activity across individuals and tissues

finding: This variant connected to SLC39A12 indicated strong associations within the caudate and sub-regions of putamen and pallidum, affecting neural development processes related to iron transport.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: As a variant within the CACNB2 gene, rs11012783 was shown to correlate with regions of the brain essential for calcium channel regulation, linking its influence to various neurodevelopmental conditions.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The variant rs1905542 was identified as a positive original finding in the context of SHTN1 gene expression within 'Whole Blood' samples. Borzoi predicted it would upregulate SHTN1 expression by creating a CEBP binding motif, interacting epistatically with nearby blood-specific motifs (IRF1/2, SPI1/B). This significant finding indicated the potential of the variant to affect gene expression regulation.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs564819152 was linked to significant cancer-related traits and showed associations with conditions like breast and melanoma cancer, corresponding to its genomic locus.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs649339 was found to be linked with SYT17, which showed both specific and significant expression in DAT-TRAP samples, indicating its potential relevance in Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The SNP rs2388595 was associated with elevated lactate levels and lower hypoxanthine levels in RBCs. Donors carrying two alleles of this SNP exhibited higher levels of PFKP, suggesting its crucial role in enhancing glycolytic flux during RBC storage, which is critical for maintaining ATP levels and reducing hemolysis.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1054399 located in HIF1AN demonstrated a significant association with metabolic phenotypes, with a p-value of 6.9E-10. This further evidenced the involvement of hypoxia-inducible factors in human metabolism.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The rs17134592 SNP, a non-synonymous variant in AKR1C4, was associated with increased serum bilirubin levels, alongside other biochemical markers. This mutation was also identified as a splicing QTL in liver and testis, indicating its essential metabolic role.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The SDF-1β gene polymorphism G801A (rs1801157) was significantly associated with an elevated risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus, demonstrating its role in the genetic predisposition to the condition.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs1268974 was identified with the highest estimated probability of being an eQTL for the gene ACAP3 on chromosome 10. This SNP has been associated with breast cancer risk in individuals of European ancestry, supporting its role in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: The SNP rs704010 emerged as a top predictor for ACAP3 with a posterior probability of being an eQTL of 0.0394. It was linked to overall breast cancer risk across different populations, including European ancestry and Han Chinese, as well as higher incidence rates for ER-/PR- breast cancer in African American cohorts.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: This SNP was identified in an intronic open chromatin region of the LHPP gene. The region also showed increased expression of multiple genes associated with other BCP ALL transcription factors, suggesting a possible role in leukemogenesis.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: A significant association was found between rs1536828 genotype and CYP2E1 DMR percent methylation, where samples homozygous for the minor allele (G/G) exhibited the lowest methylation levels. This association was tested by ANOVA and reported a p-value of 0.03.
title: Placental DNA methylation levels at CYP2E1 and IRS2 are associated with child outcome in a prospective autism study

finding: The SNP rs11101440 was associated with endometrial cancer risk. This finding contributed to understanding the gene expression changes in the endometrium during pregnancy and was linked to human-specific maternal-fetal communication and immunotolerance, particularly involving mechanisms outlined in the study regarding reproductive trait diseases and adverse pregnancy outcomes.
title: Evolutionary transcriptomics implicates new genes and pathways in human pregnancy and adverse pregnancy outcomes

finding: The SNP rs11595168 (c.1539A>C) was heterozygous in all tested samples from five familial breast cancer patients, while the c.1539C allele was very rare and not detected in available control samples. This finding indicated a potential link to altered expression or function of the <italic>UPF2</italic> gene due to the associated Alu insertion.
title: A systematic screen of breast cancer patients’ exomes for retrotransposon insertions reveals disease associated genes

finding: The SNP rs11202088 was identified in a neuronal open chromatin region using combined analyses of caQTL and ASCA methods. It was predicted to disrupt an ERG3 transcription factor binding motif, indicating its functional significance in regulating chromatin accessibility related to neuronal processes.
title: Genetic regulation of cell-type specific chromatin accessibility shapes the etiology of brain diseases

finding: SNP rs4751995, located in the PNLIPRP2 gene, was associated with the concentration of a faecal choline derivative (1-palmitoyl-2-linoleoyl-digalactosyl glycerol), showcasing a significant association with faecal metabolite levels.
title: The faecal metabolome and its determinants in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The rs7903146 SNP was positively associated with diabetic nephropathy, which was reported not to be independent of type 2 diabetes. This finding was contextualized within a study conducted in a South Indian population and a subsequent meta-analysis. The association highlighted the relevance of the Tcf7l2 gene polymorphism in relation to both diabetes and its complications.
title: Potpourri: An Epistasis Test Prioritization Algorithm via Diverse SNP Selection

finding: The SNP rs6584555 was identified as significantly contributing to postoperative atrial fibrillation in a Chinese population, indicating its relevance in heart conditions.
title: Muscle specific translational control of Cand2 by mTORC1 regulates adverse cardiac remodeling

finding: The SNP rs12766939 in the CUBILIN gene was significantly associated with mortality, presenting a hazard ratio of 1.17 (1.06 – 1.29), P < 0.002. However, this association had to be viewed with caution, as the SNP was not in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.
title: Polymorphisms in the vitamin D system and mortality - The Tromsø study

finding: Identified as the top lead SNP for WM-BAG, this variant was implicated in multiple cancer types and linked to genes such as DNAJC1, emphasizing its role in cancer-related traits.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The rs1885301 polymorphism of the ABCC2 gene significantly increased the risk of ATD-induced MPE compared with homozygous wild-type, with an odds ratio of 3.39.
title: Association of variants within the GST and other genes with anti-tubercular agents related toxicity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs2804400 polymorphism of the ABCC2 gene significantly increased the risk of ATD-induced MPE compared with homozygous wild-type, with an odds ratio of 3.47.
title: Association of variants within the GST and other genes with anti-tubercular agents related toxicity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs74577795 was identified as a trans-species SNP exhibiting a hallmark of long-term balancing selection. This SNP, located around the DMBT1 gene, contributed to the evidence of balancing selection that has been observed since before the human-chimpanzee divergence.
title: Maintenance of copy number variation at the human salivary agglutinin gene (DMBT1) by balancing selection driven by host-microbe interactions

finding: Similar to rs74577795, SNP rs79314843 was also characterized as a trans-species SNP, supporting the view of long-term balancing selection at the DMBT1 locus. This SNP reinforced the evidence that balancing selection had acted at this locus prior to the divergence of humans and chimpanzees.
title: Maintenance of copy number variation at the human salivary agglutinin gene (DMBT1) by balancing selection driven by host-microbe interactions

finding: The SNP rs11523871 was determined to serve as a proxy for two haplotypes under balancing selection at the DMBT1 gene. Analysis revealed that rs11523871-C haplotypes typically carried fewer SRCR repeats than rs11523871-A haplotypes, with a p-value of 3.282 x 10^-7 in the CEPH population. Additionally, high expression levels of DMBT1 were linked with the C allele in the colon, significantly influencing gene expression as per the genotype.
title: Maintenance of copy number variation at the human salivary agglutinin gene (DMBT1) by balancing selection driven by host-microbe interactions

finding: This SNP was originally identified in the genome-wide association study (GWAS) of BOLD amplitude and was associated with four resting state networks (RSNs) that predominantly covered prefrontal regions. This finding highlighted its relevance in understanding the genetic basis of brain functionality.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: Similar to rs7080018, this SNP was part of the initial discovery from the GWAS focused on BOLD amplitude. It was also associated with four RSNs primarily in prefrontal areas, contributing to the understanding of heritable factors influencing brain activation networks.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: Like the previous SNPs, rs67221163 was linked to four RSNs in the prefrontal cortex identified in Elliott et al.'s study. Its identification as a part of the genetic architecture underlying RSN activity underscores its significance.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: IL2RA gene rs2104286 was found to be associated with the onset and severity of multiple sclerosis, suggesting potential cross-disease relevance and its role in autoimmune pathways that may also relate to metabolic disorders like T2DM.
title: Analysis of key genes and pathways associated with the pathogenesis of Type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: SNP rs11191352 was associated with the SmokingInitiation phenotype with a significant p-value of 2.12 x 10^-7. It was identified as a cis-eQTL for nearby genes in striatal regions, indicating its potential functional role in addiction-related traits.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: Variant rs10786689 was associated with a decrease in enhancer activity and was thought to regulate nuclear factor kappa B subunit 2 (NFKB2) and suppressor of fused homolog (SUFU). This variant was noted for its potential protective effect as both genes were up-regulated in SCZ patients.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs112049982 was observed to increase enhancer activity in primary cells but decreased in organoids, suggested to be due to OLIG2 expression dynamics, indicating its role in the regulation of oligodendrocyte-related genes.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs2883420 generated increased enhancer activity through alternative alleles disrupting repressive transcription factor motifs (SRY and SOX2), further establishing its significance in neurodevelopmental regulatory mechanisms.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The SNP rs12220909 was associated with diminished cancer susceptibility, specifically noted to result in the loss of 95% of its target genes and was presented as having a strong impact on miRNA-mediated gene regulation.
title: Impact and evolutionary determinants of Neanderthal introgression on transcriptional and post-transcriptional regulation

finding: The SNP rs11257655 was co-localised with the eQTL rs11257658 at the CAMK1D locus, relating to type 2 diabetes. The G allele of rs11257658 was associated with decreased expression of CAMK1D in human islets, situated approximately 82 kb upstream of the CAMK1D promoter.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs11257658 exhibited a strong co-localization with the GWAS signal rs11257655 at the CAMK1D locus. The G allele of rs11257658 correlated with reduced expression of CAMK1D, which encodes a calcium-dependent protein kinase, emphasizing its role in the mechanism for type 2 diabetes.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs7903146 at the TCF7L2 locus was associated with increased expression of TCF7L2 in islets and was located within an enhancer region, marked as significant for type 2 diabetes risk, yet showcased notably lower chromatin accessibility in the EndoC-βH1 cell type.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs73349121 was significant in the Blacks-only meta-analysis with a p-value of 0.0001, indicating a genetic effect similar to what was found in the Whites-only analysis. This aligns with the broader understanding of inter-individual variations in mitochondrial DNA copy number (mtDNA-CN).
title: Genetic analysis of mitochondrial DNA copy number and associated traits identifies loci implicated in nucleotide metabolism, platelet activation, and megakaryocyte proliferation, and reveals a causal association of mitochondrial function with mortality

finding: The study documented that the SNP rs11101437 was associated with increased expression of Chi3l1, which played a critical role in promoting glioblastoma malignancy. Specifically, it was found that this SNP correlated with alterations in GSC states, enhancing pro-oncogenic signaling through MAPK pathways, thus implicating it as a significant factor in glioblastoma pathology.
title: Chi3l1 is a modulator of glioma stem cell states and a therapeutic vulnerability for glioblastoma

finding: This sSNP was linked to an unannotated exon skipping splicing event for AS3MT and was associated with a schizophrenia GWAS index SNP. The risk allele (T) was related to increased skipping of the exon.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: The SNP rs11191419 was associated with an exon skipping event in AS3MT that was found to colocalize with the schizophrenia GWAS index SNP rs3740400, showing its relevance in neurodevelopmental pathways.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: This variant rs7085104 was genetically linked (in LD) to rs3740400, associated with AS3MT exon skipping, further validating the role this SNP has in neuropsychiatric disorder pathways.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: The SNP rs2388595 was positively associated with glycolytic metabolic traits, particularly confirming strong positive correlations with lactate levels and negative associations with hypoxanthine levels. Its effect was observed across a diverse cohort of blood donors, influencing glycolytic metabolite levels significantly alongside donor age and sex.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Red Blood Cell Glycolysis

finding: The SNP rs61835134 was linked to decreased adjusted hemoglobin increments in transfusion recipients and identified as a top genetic predictor of ATP levels, revealing its potential role in influencing hemolysis outcomes post-transfusion.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Red Blood Cell Glycolysis

finding: Research showed that the rs11523871 C haplotypes typically carried fewer SRCR domain repeats compared to A haplotypes, supporting balancing selection driven by the effects of these haplotypes. There was also significant evidence linking the C allele to higher expression levels of the DMBT1 gene in the colon, indicating its potential functional significance.
title: Maintenance of copy number variation at the human salivary agglutinin gene (DMBT1) by balancing selection driven by host-microbe interactions

finding: The SNP rs11813268, located in an intergenic region at 10q24.33, showed associations with melanoma and prostate cancer, which had not been previously reported in relation to these specific cancers.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The rs1129555 SNP was associated with variations in serum lipid profiles specifically in the Maonan and Han populations, which connected to the finding that the hypomorphic form of GPAM resulted in hypomyelination of the corticospinal tract in a cerebral palsy (CP) patient with normal intelligence. This indicates a crucial link between lipid metabolism and neurological functions, particularly in the context of CP.
title: In-depth analysis reveals complex molecular etiology of idiopathic cerebral palsy

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs11101534 was that it influenced the behavior of natural killer (NK) cells, specifically promoting a resting state in tumor environments. This SNP's relevance emerged from the study of NK cells in colon cancer liver metastasis (CCLM), where the presence of resting NK cells correlated with a worse prognosis, thereby highlighting its significance in tumor dynamics and potential therapeutic implications in cancer treatment.
title: Resting natural killer cells promote the progress of colon cancer liver metastasis by elevating tumor-derived sSCF

finding: The study replicated the association of rs11255841 with colorectal cancer, originally identified in GWAS of European ancestry, with an odds ratio of 2.2, indicating a significant risk factor in this Indonesian population.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: This SNP was associated with a gene that demonstrated enriched and specific expression in dopamine neurons, highlighting its relevance in the context of Parkinson's disease risk.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The SNP rs2227564, located in the urokinase-plasminogen activator gene, was found to have a significant association with late onset Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) based on a meta-analysis conducted by Wu et al. in 2013. This finding provided evidence for the genetic involvement of the urokinase pathway in the pathogenesis of AD.
title: Epigallocatechin Gallate Modulates Microglia Phenotype to Suppress Pro-Inflammatory Signalling Cues and Inhibit Phagocytosis

finding: The SNP rs11010102 was associated with decreased tumorigenic properties in human melanoma cells related to Pannexin 1 (PANX1) inhibition, as reported by Freeman et al. in 2019. This finding provided insight into PANX1's role in cancer progression.
title: Novel Pannexin 1 isoform is increased in cancer

finding: The SNP rs11257655 was identified as the predominant SNP within the CDC123/CaMK1D locus on chromosome 10, which showed a strong association with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in European and Asian populations. The study indicated that the C to T change in the enhancer region of rs11257655 led to DNA hypomethylation and enhanced binding of transcription factors FOXA1/FOXA2 to the enhancer. This mechanism resulted in increased transcription of the CaMK1D gene, suggesting that elevated CaMK1D expression could contribute to the development of T2D.
title: CaMK1D signaling in AgRP neurons promotes ghrelin-mediated food intake

finding: The SNP rs603424 was significantly associated with changes in lipid metabolites, implying a role in fatty acid metabolism due to its effect on the SCD gene coding for the enzyme Stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase. The findings indicated that the SNP mutation led to a reduction in SCD enzyme activity, resulting in notable shifts in circulating phospholipid levels and low levels of palmitoleate. The top ten most changed metabolites linked to this SNP were predominantly lipids, supporting the enzyme's functionality.
title: Genome scale metabolic network modelling for metabolic profile predictions

finding: The intronic variant rs3814637 within CYP2C19 was associated with warfarin response. The study reported a significant relationship between rs3814637 allele dosage and warfarin maintenance dose (p <= 1.0 × 10^-46). Normal metabolizers of CYP2C19 had an average daily dose of 4.8 mg, which was lower than the 5.3 mg observed in other metabolizer classes. This variant was contained within normal functioning alleles and was noted to have a strong influence on the warfarin maintenance dose in the participant cohort.
title: Drug Response Pharmacogenetics for 200,000 UK Biobank Participants

finding: The SNP rs3824662, located within the GATA3 gene, was identified as an ATAC-QTL associated with the risk of developing B-cell lineage acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL). This association was further validated as rs3824662 was found to exhibit differential allele-specific activity in acute lymphoblastic leukemia patient-derived xenograft (PDX) samples.
title: Epigenomic mapping in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia identifies transcriptional regulators and noncoding variants promoting distinct chromatin architectures

finding: Lead SNP rs2274224, which is an exonic SNP in PLCCE1:PLCE1-AS1, showed increased interhemispheric connectivity in minor allele carriers (C, MAF = 0.44) compared to non-carriers, indicating enhanced language network integration.
title: Imaging genetics of language network functional connectivity reveals links with language-related abilities, dyslexia and handedness

finding: The SNP rs2001389 was associated with pancreatic cancer risk and was noted to weaken the binding activity of CCCTC-binding factor (CTCF). It was also found to correlate with lower expression levels of MFSD13A/TMEM180. This suggests that changes in this SNP may influence both the transcriptional regulation of TMEM180 and its potential role in cancer cell proliferation.
title: Topological analysis of TMEM180, a newly identified membrane protein that is highly expressed in colorectal cancer cells

finding: This exonic SNP was associated with PLCCE1:PLCE1-AS1 on chromosome 10 and showed increased interhemispheric connectivity in carriers of the minor allele (C), indicating its potential impact on connectivity in the language network.
title: Imaging genetics of language network functional connectivity reveals links with language-related abilities, dyslexia and handedness

finding: This SNP was found associated in opposite directions with luminal A-like disease (OR 1.10, p=4.96×10^-27) and risk of TN disease (OR 0.96, p=0.02). It was also associated with ER and grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This variant was strongly associated with risk of luminal-like subtypes with an OR of 1.29 (95% CI 1.27 to 1.31) and a p-value of 2.01×10^-231; also showed associations with ER.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: It was associated with risk of luminal-like subtypes (OR 1.35, 95% CI 1.33 to 1.37, p=5.00×10^-300) and showed strong evidence for association with ER.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: rs1628768 was identified as a cortical expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for genes related to schizophrenia in the adult cortex, specifically affecting INA, AS3MT, NT5C2, and WBP1L. It demonstrated a significant association with cortical surface area.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The study investigated the role of the 5'-FKH-T binding site located 5' of and proximal to the origin recognition complex (ORC) site at the chromosomal origin ARS1529.5. It was uncovered that Fkh1, notably through its forkhead associated (FHA) domain, was pivotal in promoting ORC-origin binding and activity. By performing various assays, researchers demonstrated that mutations leading to enhanced affinity of the ORC site could bypass the requirement for the 5'-FKH-T site, affirming the necessity of this site for the effective function of ARS1529.5. The findings highlighted that mutations in this region significantly reduced the ARS activity and ORC binding, thus establishing the 5'-FKH-T site as essential for ARS1529.5's role as a positive-chromatin origin in yeast.
title: The Fkh1 Forkhead Associated Domain Promotes ORC Binding to a Subset of DNA Replication Origins in Budding Yeast

finding: The allele A of the variant rs2770197 in subcutaneous adipose tissue was associated with an increase in vacuole size and cell membrane deterioration, indicative of tissue degradation. The pathway analysis revealed enrichment for adipogenesis and fatty acid metabolism pathways, which play critical roles in obesity.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs11200385, connected to the mHA YQEIAAIPSAGRERQ from the gene TACC2, was associated with an increased risk of treatment-related mortality (TRM), showing an HR of 3.05 and a 95% CI of [1.75, 5.31], with a P-value of 0.02 in recipients with HLA-DRB1*15:01.
title: Associations of Minor Histocompatibility Antigens with Clinical Outcomes Following Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation

finding: The risk allele of rs1412444 was associated with increased LIPA mRNA, protein, and enzyme activity in human myeloid cells, confirming its role as the lead SNP in CAD risk.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: rs1412445 was identified as having independent effects on LIPA expression and CAD risk, demonstrating significant association in eQTL analyses.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: The risk allele of rs1320496 created a PU.1 binding site, enhancing the activity of the LIPA enhancer region, which was crucial in driving higher LIPA expression in myeloid cells.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: The risk allele (C) of rs1051338 was associated with increased LIPA mRNA and enzyme activity, supporting earlier findings regarding its role in CAD.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: The SNP rs35054928 was located in a region with a significant association with breast cancer susceptibility, specifically a 28 kb deletion upstream of FGFR2. It was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with the deletion, with a D' value of 0.82. The effect size of the concurrent deletion showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.30, indicating a likely association.
title: Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and breast cancer risk

finding: Similarly, SNP rs2981578 was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with the previously mentioned 28 kb deletion upstream of FGFR2 (D' = 0.88). This SNP contributed to the detection of an odds ratio (OR) of 1.30 when conditioned with the corresponding deletion, indicating its relevance in breast cancer risk.
title: Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and breast cancer risk

finding: The VCL gene SNP rs4746172 was shown to have a sex-specific association with hypertension, which can complicate the metabolic balance in individuals predisposed to gestational diabetes.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs3758581 variant showed a MAF of 95.1% in Hong Kong Cantonese and was associated with the drug response to fluoxetine, fluvoxamine, and voriconazole. This association was based on three distinct in vitro studies.
title: HKG: An open genetic variant database of 205 Hong Kong Cantonese exomes

finding: The SNP rs1890185 was found to be highly correlated (R² > 0.6) with the insertion of L1#1 in a linkage disequilibrium (LD) block. This LD block contained 72 SNPs that were significantly associated with 10 diseases or disorders, including 13 risk SNPs from 11 schizophrenia studies, indicating its likely role in the genetic architecture of neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Machine learning reveals bilateral distribution of somatic L1 insertions in human neurons and glia

finding: The SNP rs3824662, located in the GATA3 gene, was identified as an ATAC-QTL that was associated with an increased risk of developing B-cell lineage acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL). This finding was corroborated by its identification in ALL patient-derived xenograft (PDX) samples, indicating its significant role in modifying chromatin accessibility within the context of B-ALL.
title: Epigenomic mapping in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia identifies transcriptional regulators and noncoding variants promoting distinct chromatin architectures

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was identified as a causal T2D variant that overlaps with a phenotype-associated beta cell cRE showing reduced accessibility in individuals with higher BMI (PIP=0.99), thereby implicating it in T2D risk.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: SNP rs12263497 was associated with gene Inpp5f and identified with connections to various genetic disorders.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The minor allele (C; frequency 0.16) of rs2486758 was found to be associated with higher plasma corticosterone and an elevated corticosterone:cortisol ratio in ORCADES and ET2DS, as well as with overnight urinary corticosterone in SKIPOGH. This SNP was linked to 'relative corticosterone deficiency', suggesting a greater production of cortisol over corticosterone, and influencing metabolic syndrome features.
title: Associations of ‘Relative corticosterone deficiency’ with genetic variation in CYP17A1 and metabolic syndrome features

finding: The rs1801157 SNP, located in the cxcl12 gene, was associated with breast cancer in a study conducted in Pakistan. The findings suggested its involvement in the cxcl12–cxcr4 associated biological regulatory network, highlighting its potential role in metastasis, particularly given the focus on calcium signaling and specific metastasis patterns in breast cancer.
title: Pan-cancer study on transition of signaling systems from primary to metastatic tumors

finding: The intronic SNP rs117896735, located within the Sac2/INPP5F gene, was identified as a Parkinson's disease (PD) risk locus through genome-wide association studies (GWAS). Sac2 was implicated in the endocytic pathway and was found to have overlapping functions with synaptojanin 1 (SJ1) in the regulation of phosphoinositide pools at synapses, suggesting its role as a risk gene for PD.
title: Absence of Sac2/INPP5F enhances the phenotype of a Parkinson’s disease mutation of synaptojanin 1

finding: The SNP rs72846714 was identified as a germline polymorphism linked to erythrocyte TGN levels during 6-mercaptopurine (6-MP) treatment in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). Its allele was associated with lower TGN levels, suggesting its role in influencing drug metabolism. However, it was determined not to be in a regulatory element, with its association explained by linkage disequilibrium with another functional variant, rs12256506.
title: Effects of NT5C2 germline variants on 6-mecaptopurine metabolism in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs58700372 was found to directly alter the activity of an intronic enhancer, resulting in higher transcription activity of the NT5C2 gene, which was associated with reduced 6-MP metabolism as reflected by lower TGN levels in patients. This variant represented a novel association independent of the previously identified GWAS signal.
title: Effects of NT5C2 germline variants on 6-mecaptopurine metabolism in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: Linked through strong association findings, rs12256506 was in proximity to rs72846714 and was identified as a functional variant that activates NT5C2 transcription, explaining the association signal observed in rs72846714. Its activation was tied to lower TGN levels, consistent with its role in drug metabolism.
title: Effects of NT5C2 germline variants on 6-mecaptopurine metabolism in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The study highlighted that the TCF7L2-rs7903146 SNP had modifying effects on the relationship between metabolites related to purine catabolism and the risk of type 2 diabetes incidence. This finding indicated that the SNP was originally linked to metabolic pathways, contributing to the understanding of how metabolic dysregulation could be related to conditions such as ALS progression.
title: Dysregulated expanded endocannabinoid system as therapeutic targets of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs11101513 was associated with matrisome alterations in ovarian cancer progression, which was identified as a key feature affecting the transcriptomic landscape of the cancerous state. This finding indicated that the gene expression profiles of extracellular matrix components may serve as important biomarkers in understanding the biology of ovarian cancer.
title: Extracellular matrix gene expression signatures as cell type and cell state identifiers

finding: This SNP functioned as the lead stress-interactive eQTL for the PRKCQ eGene in the MeA, with its interaction effect dependent on stress exposure.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The rs41290536 variant altered a canonical PAS motif in the BLOC1S2 gene, leading to expression changes that could be connected to an increased predisposition to squamous cell lung carcinoma, given its complete linkage disequilibrium with two known variants associated with the disease.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The rs28372851 variant was noted for its complete linkage disequilibrium with rs41290536, both connected to risk predisposition for squamous cell lung carcinoma, indicating a potential relationship between genetic variation and cancer susceptibility.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The rs12765052 variant, like rs28372851, was in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs41290536 and suggested to be involved in cancer predisposition related to squamous cell lung carcinoma.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs2664280 was identified in strong LD with GWAS peaks for psoriasis. It disrupted AP1 motifs, indicating a regulatory role relevant to transcriptional changes in inflammatory conditions.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2675662 was shown to be linked to psoriasis and inflammatory bowel disease, reinforcing its candidacy as a functional variant affecting these pathologies.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2633310 was connected with Type 2 diabetes and other inflammatory conditions via GWAS data, reinforcing its suspected regulatory role within disease pathways.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs61837215 was strongly linked with breast cancer, demonstrating effective disruption of motif binding linked to tumorigenesis.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2754412 correlated with several neurodegenerative diseases and provided evidence for its role in influencing disease mechanisms through transcription regulation.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2104286 in the IL2RA gene was positively associated with multiple sclerosis onset and severity in patients from Serbia, suggesting a significant role in the disease process.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs1046747 SNP was classified under L3 pleiotropy with a PVS of 0.543 and was associated with phenotypes such as asthma, leukemia, lymphoma, lymphopenia, and cardiovascular system disease.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was found to be associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes. This finding was contingent upon its role in modulating incretin action, as reported by Villareal et al. in their 2010 study published in Diabetes. The association highlighted the significance of TCF7L2 variants in the pathophysiology of diabetes.
title: Disentangling genetic feature selection and aggregation in transcriptome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs35339173 was associated with monocyte count and implicated in PPIF regulation. It disrupts a GATA1 motif, supporting its important role in hematopoiesis and monocyte differentiation.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: Linked to lymphocyte count, rs1250546 overlaps an inferred transcription factor footprint for GLI2 in NK cells, showcasing its regulatory influence on lymphocyte development.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The T risk allele at rs7903146 was associated with elevated proinsulin levels, reduced first-phase insulin secretion, and impaired responses to the incretin hormone glucagon-like peptide 1 (GLP-1). Additionally, it showed a significant association with increased risk of type 2 diabetes due to its effect on insulin secretion.
title: Reduced expression of TCF7L2 in adipocyte impairs glucose tolerance associated with decreased insulin secretion, incretins levels and lipid metabolism dysregulation in male mice

finding: The study validated the effect of the HDR allele at rs12269414 on chromatin accessibility relative to the wild type (WT) allele. This SNP was associated with a CTCF binding site, and defined deletions around the SNP showed varying effects on chromatin accessibility. Notably, certain deletion alleles did not result in changes, suggesting that the CTCF motif remained intact.
title: Screening for functional regulatory variants in open chromatin using GenIE-ATAC

finding: This missense variant in BAG3 was found to be associated with dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) and progression to heart failure (HF). The variant demonstrated a high linkage disequilibrium with the sentinel variant rs17617337, suggesting a strong relationship between this SNP and the phenotype of HF.
title: Genome-wide association study provides new insights into the genetic architecture and pathogenesis of heart failure

finding: The variant rs2209972 was specifically associated with increased body mass index, higher fasting insulin levels, and insulin resistance in women with polycystic ovary syndrome, particularly observed within a Chinese population. This association was noted to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with other variants within the lncRAP2 locus, thereby confining its phenotypic associations primarily to this genetic locus.
title: An adipocyte-specific lncRAP2 – Igf2bp2 complex enhances adipogenesis and energy expenditure by stabilizing target mRNAs

finding: The study identified rs7903146 near the TCF7L2 locus as a significant variant associated with age at diagnosis of Type 2 Diabetes (T2D). The p-value was 2.4 x 10^-12 with a Beta of -0.436, showing that this variant was consistently associated with lower age of diagnosis across ethnic cohorts.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: The study identified rs3011366 at the WDR11 locus as a novel signal specifically in South Asian Indian cohorts with a significant p-value of 2.4 x 10^-8 and a Beta of 1.44. This SNP was not associated with age of onset in European cohorts, highlighting potential ethnic-specific genetic influences.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: This novel variant near TCF7L2 was associated with age of diagnosis of T2D exclusively in South Indians, demonstrating lower frequency in European populations. Its significance was indicated by a p-value < 3.2E-05 and showed a unique ethnic effect on T2D onset.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: The SNP rs1775555 was found to be a fibroblast-specific eQTL for GATA3 and GATA3-AS1, with significant p-values (p=7.4×10−70 and p=1.8×10−45 respectively). It also acted as a corresponding trans-eQTL for MSTN on chromosome 2. Colocalization with immune traits such as asthma suggested a broad impact on immune-related phenotypes.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs2926494 was identified as a lead eVariant in whole blood analyses, suggesting that it had a significant role in mediating gene expression in different blood cell types, contributing to the understanding of allelic heterogeneity in eQTLs across various cell types.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs10740051 was identified as a lead eVariant in monocyte-specific analyses, highlighting its importance in gene regulation within that cell type. This indicated that different eQTLs could actively regulate gene expression in various blood cell types.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The minor allele (T) of this intronic variant was associated with increased total cholesterol (CHOL), with β 0.34 CHOL in Africans (p=1.5 × 10⁻⁴) and β 0.28 CHOL in AA (p=2.6 × 10⁻⁵). This variant alters a regulatory motif for sterol regulatory element-binding proteins (SREBPs), key transcription factors in lipid metabolism.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The findings revealed chromatin accessibility gains at the rs2387397 variant, which was associated with Celiac Disease (PP = 0.32), particularly within the natural killer (NK) and T-cell clusters.
title: Droplet-based combinatorial indexing for massive scale single-cell epigenomics

finding: The SNP rs12775208, found within the NKX6-2 gene on chromosome 10, was significantly associated with RBA. NKX6-2 is involved in the regulation of myelin sheath formation and maintenance in the central nervous system, which may link it to overall brain health.
title: Improving brain age estimates with deep learning leads to identification of novel genetic factors associated with brain aging

finding: A low-frequency coding variant in A1CF was associated with triglycerides and total cholesterol in over 300K individuals, and the association was experimentally validated in a mouse model.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The rs12777823 SNP in CYP2C9 was identified as being associated with decreased warfarin dose requirement specifically in African Americans. This finding highlighted a significant genetic factor affecting drug response within this population, demonstrating the need for targeted pharmacogenomics studies that include underrepresented groups.
title: Uncovering the role admixture in health disparities: Assocication of hepatocyte gene expression and DNA methylation to African Ancestry in African-Americans

finding: The rs10993994 SNP exhibited a strong association with prostate cancer susceptibility. It was identified that this variant had preferential binding to the CREB transcription factor, which subsequently led to lower expression levels of MSMB. This finding was significant as higher MSMB expression correlated with decreased recurrence of prostate cancer following surgical removal, indicating a relationship between this SNP, MSMB expression, and prostate cancer outcomes.
title: Diagnostic Evidence Gauge of Spatial Transcriptomics (DEGAS): Using transfer learning to map clinical data to spatial transcriptomics in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs11010062 was associated with increased serum leptin levels, which are implicated in the development of mammary carcinoma in cats. This finding related to obesity as a risk factor for breast cancer, reinforcing the potential importance of leptin and leptin receptors in this context.
title: Serum levels and tumour expression of leptin and leptin receptor as promising clinical biomarkers of specific feline mammary carcinoma subtypes

finding: The SNP rs2146192 was found to be highly correlated with blood levels of SFTPD with an r2 value of 0.67, indicating its significance in relation to lung function.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: The SNP rs55855057 exhibited a strong correlation with Cystatin C levels (r2 = 0.64), underscoring its potential impact on immune responses.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: This SNP showed an exceptionally high correlation (r2 = 0.98) with decreased haemoglobin levels and was also associated with decreased haematocrit (r2 = 0.98), highlighting its relevance in blood traits.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: Similar to rs61859980, this SNP had an r2 of 1.0 associated with decreased haemoglobin, suggesting a critical role in hematological parameters.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: The SNP rs36073865 displayed a perfect correlation (r2 = 1.0) with increased levels of blood urea, which may indicate its involvement in metabolic processes.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: This SNP was correlated with elevated blood urea levels (r2 = 0.62), further supporting its relevance in metabolic functions.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: The correlation of this SNP with increased levels of blood urea was also noted with an r2 of 0.6, reaffirming its association with metabolic traits.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: This SNP, related to IFIT5, demonstrated significant differences in expression levels between Pitta and Kapha individuals, contributing to antiviral responses.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The analysis of rs11101533 revealed a cooperative interaction with HSF1 that potentiated the actions of ESR1, particularly in the context of estrogen signaling in breast cancer.
title: Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1) as a new tethering factor for ESR1 supporting its action in breast cancer

finding: The GATA3 SNP (rs3824662) was associated with the Ph-like BCP-ALL, indicating its role in predisposing to this subtype of leukemia.
title: An instructive role for IL7RA in the development of human B-cell precursor leukemia

finding: The progenitor sSNP rs3740400 was linked to an unannotated exon skipping event in AS3MT, and this event was colocalized with index GWAS SNP rs11191419 related to schizophrenia.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: A low-frequency coding variant rs41274050 in A1CF was associated with triglycerides and total cholesterol in over 300K individuals of various ancestries, and this association was validated experimentally in a mouse model.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs10993994, located within the MSMB gene in a BBIS region on chr10, was associated with prostate cancer. The analysis revealed a significant association reflected in a meta-analysis with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 and a P-value of 2.86×10^-7 after correcting for strand flips.
title: Inverted genomic regions between reference genome builds in humans impact imputation accuracy and decrease the power of association testing

finding: The palindromic SNP rs10763546 exhibited poor imputation accuracy due to a 1-bp error in genome build conversion. However, after correcting with the triple-liftOver method, its association with prostate cancer was shown to be significant, with a meta-analysis yielding an OR of 1.14 and a P-value of 2.86×10^-7, compared to the previous marginal evidence of association.
title: Inverted genomic regions between reference genome builds in humans impact imputation accuracy and decrease the power of association testing

finding: The rs2981579 variant was associated with the regulation of FGFR2 in breast cancer by mapping to its transcription start site and forming interactions with distal regulatory regions. This explained its contribution to FGFR2 gene expression linked to breast cancer progression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs4752575 variant was shown to be connected to breast cancer susceptibility through its interactions with regulatory elements influencing FGFR2 expression, underscoring its role in cancer mechanisms.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs2234962 variant, resulting in the BAG3<C151R> amino acid change, was associated with a decreased incidence of heart failure and provided enhanced resilience to proteotoxic stress in cardiomyocytes. Specifically, cardiomyocytes expressing the BAG3<C151R> variant showed improved binding with proteins that help maintain myofibrillar integrity, leading to a protective response against proteotoxic stress in an allele dose-dependent manner.
title: Functional analysis of a common BAG3 allele associated with protection from heart failure

finding: The SNP rs2001389 was reported to be significantly associated with pancreatic cancer risk. It was found to weaken the binding activity of the transcriptional repressor CCCTC-binding factor (CTCF), leading to lower expression of the gene MFSD13A/TMEM180. Additionally, knockdown of MFSD13A/TMEM180 using siRNA increased the proliferation of pancreatic cancer cell lines, suggesting a potential link between this SNP and cancer proliferation.
title: Topological analysis of TMEM180, a newly identified membrane protein that is highly expressed in colorectal cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs2435357 was found to have a very strong association with HSCR (60% vs. 27% in controls, OR=4.0, P=1.1×10^-123), affirming its role as a significant original finding.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs2506030 was associated with HSCR (56% vs. 39%, OR=2.0, P=2.8×10^-30), representing a significant original finding in the context of previous associations.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs7069590 showed an association with HSCR (84% vs. 77%, OR=1.5, P=1.8×10^-7), constituting an original finding in this study.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs17476364 was identified as an intronic variant in the hexokinase 1 (HK1) region on chromosome 10. It linked 11 of 12 red blood cell-related clinical traits analyzed with average SpO2 during sleep. This variant was previously reported and reached genome-wide significance in association with minimum and average SpO2.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: The SNP rs1040934 was involved in the exploration of LiDAR's utility for natural resource managers. This original finding emphasized the role of LiDAR technology in improving ecological monitoring capabilities and resource management strategies.
title: Terrestrial 3D Laser Scanning for Ecosystem and Fire Effects Monitoring

finding: The SNP rs11010112 was referenced in Wang et al. (2019), where the authors explored the concept of hypoxic radioresistance and the role of reactive oxygen species (ROS) in overcoming vulnerabilities in hypoxic conditions. This work contributes to the understanding of how such mechanisms might relate to radiosensitivity in human cells, possibly leveraging insights related to this SNP.
title: Engineering Radioprotective Human Cells Using the Tardigrade Damage Suppressor Protein, DSUP

finding: The findings indicated that rs10490924 in the ARMS2/HTRA1 region showed a significantly stronger association with polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy (PCV) compared to neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD). This association highlighted the role of genetic factors in the pathogenesis of PCV, which is believed to involve an interplay of polygenic influences.
title: Hyaluronidase-1-mediated glycocalyx impairment underlies endothelial abnormalities in polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy

finding: The rs2506030 SNP is associated with the RET enhancer activity affecting Hirschsprung disease (HSCR) risk. Genotyping revealed a significant correlation between the S haplotype containing this variant and decreased RET gene expression in human fetal gut tissue, which aligns with the role of RET in enteric nervous system development.
title: RET enhancer haplotype-dependent remodeling of the human fetal gut development program

finding: The rs7069590 SNP was part of the common haplotype associated with HSCR, contributing to diminished expression of RET in fetal tissues when the susceptible (S) haplotype was present. This finding highlighted that variations in this SNP could be part of the genetic architecture leading to HSCR related deficits.
title: RET enhancer haplotype-dependent remodeling of the human fetal gut development program

finding: The rs2435357 SNP was identified within the RET enhancer region associated with HSCR risk. Its presence in the S haplotype corresponded with lower RET expression levels in the analyzed fetal stomach and intestine tissues, thereby implicating it in alterations of gut development pertinent to HSCR.
title: RET enhancer haplotype-dependent remodeling of the human fetal gut development program

finding: The SNP rs55710213 was found to regulate SCD1 expression by modulating HNF4A binding, which is significant in lipid metabolism and directly related to the pathway HNF4A regulates.
title: HNF4α regulates acyl chain remodeling and ether lipid accumulation in hepatic steatosis

finding: Similar to rs55710213, SNP rs56334587 was also identified to regulate SCD1 expression through modulation of HNF4A binding, impacting lipid metabolism pathways.
title: HNF4α regulates acyl chain remodeling and ether lipid accumulation in hepatic steatosis

finding: The SNP rs11101445 was associated with NF-kB dependent chemokine signaling in pancreatic cancer. This finding emphasized its relevance in the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), where such signaling pathways are known to influence tumor proliferation and metastasis. The mutation was linked to the mechanisms driving tumor invasiveness and could contribute to the poor prognosis often observed with KRAS mutations in PDAC cases.
title: Adaptation to ARF6-depletion in KRAS-driven PDAC is abolished by targeting TLR2

finding: The SNP rs185932673 was associated with OSA, located near Calcium/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase ID (CAMK1D), with a p-value of 2.4 x 10^-8. This association was noted despite the variant being rare in the Finnish population, which warrants cautious interpretation.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs11101465 was associated with the modulation of autophagy in relation to cancer therapies. It was highlighted in the context of how specific drugs influence core autophagy-related proteins, providing insights into potential therapeutic strategies for cancer treatment.
title: Mechanisms of Action of Autophagy Modulators Dissected by Quantitative Systems Pharmacology Analysis

finding: The SNP rs576289 on chromosome 10 was associated with the vertical component of brain asymmetry. With a MAF of 3.36%, it exhibited a positive additive effect with increasing A alleles, reflected in a t-value of 5.51 and a p-value of 3.64e-08. This SNP is located near the gene RNU7-165P and provided insights into genetic contributions to brain asymmetry.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: The SNP rs10993994 was identified as a consistently replicated susceptibility signal for prostate cancer. The association P-value dropped from 2.86×10^-7 to a non-significant level after the error in imputation due to a build conversion was corrected.
title: Inverted genomic regions between reference genome builds in humans impact imputation accuracy and decrease the power of association testing

finding: The SNP rs10763546 showed an association with prostate cancer in the original analysis yielding an OR of 1.11 and a P-value of 0.0011. However, following manual correction using the tool liftOver, the imputation accuracy for rs10763546 improved to Rsq = 1, resulting in a new meta-analysis association signal of OR = 1.14 and P = 2.86×10^-7, indicating a nearly genome-wide significant finding.
title: Inverted genomic regions between reference genome builds in humans impact imputation accuracy and decrease the power of association testing

finding: The investigation revealed that the risk allele (C) for SNP rs9416017 was inversely correlated with MICU1 gene expression in both tibial and coronary artery tissues. This correlation was significant in the context of coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), indicating that higher expression of MICU1 may be protective against CABG. Furthermore, two-sample Mendelian randomization suggested that increased MICU1 expression contributed to a reduced risk of CABG, highlighting a crucial role of MICU1 in vascular health and the pathogenesis of vascular inflammation and atherosclerosis.
title: Endothelial MICU1 protects against vascular inflammation and atherosclerosis by inhibiting mitochondrial calcium uptake

finding: Research by Fricker et al. in 2019 revealed that a CNN classifier was capable of identifying tree species in mixed-conifer forests from hyperspectral imagery, showcasing the technique's reliability even with diverse species.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs72840788 was identified as the lead SNP associated with both right ventricular end systolic volume (RVESV) and left ventricular end systolic volume (LVESV), demonstrating strong correlation with the SNP rs2234962, which causes a missense change in the BAG3 protein. This indicates a shared genetic factor influencing both right and left heart measurements.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs2234962, which leads to the missense change p.Cys151Arg in the BAG3 protein, was found to have near perfect correlation with the lead SNP rs72840788. This derived from the significant findings associated with both RVESV and LVESV, underlining its importance in cardiac structural traits.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs11013860 in the CACNB2 gene correlated with prefrontal cortex thickness in bipolar patients experiencing first-episode mania.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Bipolar Disorder by Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11190870 was identified as the most commonly associated variant with an increased risk of adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS). It was located in a highly conserved enhancer element downstream of the LBX1 gene. Research indicated that the T allele, which is considered high risk, increased the activity of this enhancer and subsequently upregulated LBX1 transcription, contributing to greater susceptibility to AIS.
title: Deletion of a conserved genomic region associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis leads to vertebral rotation in mice

finding: The study reported that the mannose binding lectin gene 2 (rs1800450) missense variant may have contributed to the development and severity of COVID-19 infection. This finding highlighted the genetic association between this SNP and the immune response to SARS-CoV-2, suggesting its relevance in the pathogenesis of severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 control complement-induced inflammatory responses to SARS-CoV-2

finding: This SNP presented evidence for cross-disorder GxS interaction (p=6.4×10−7), but further details regarding its specific role or functions weren't specified.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The SNP rs11000765 was the peak eSNP affecting FUT11, with p = 1.91 x 10^-18. This SNP colocalised with genetic associations for asthma and lung function, emphasizing its relevance to respiratory conditions.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs7068821 was identified as the most likely candidate causal variant in the chr10:90001035-90066035 locus associated with type 1 diabetes, colocalizing with a unique adult whole pancreas eQTL. This variant had a posterior probability of 85.5% and suggested potential roles of both PTEN and LIPJ as candidate causal genes.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: Associated with multiple amplitude traits in brain function, rs2274224 (nearest gene PLCE1) influenced intrinsic brain activity, indicative of potential roles in cognitive functions and neurodegenerative risks.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: This SNP, related to INPP5A, contributed to amplitude traits and shared genetic influences in brain networks, reflecting its possible implications in cognitive performance and brain disorders.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: This SNP in PWWP2B was among those replicated in European and non-European cohorts, linking it to multiple brain connectivity traits.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Linked to PLCE1, rs11187838 exhibited significant associations in both amplitude and connectivity traits, reinforcing its role in cognitive function.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs2388595 was associated with increased PFKP protein levels and impacted glycolytic fluxes in stored human RBCs. Donors carrying two alleles of this SNP showed significantly higher ATP levels, lower hypoxanthine levels, and reduced hemolysis post-storage.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs7904973 was found to be associated with increased LDL cholesterol and was also identified as an apaQTL linked with increased usage of an intronic polyadenylation site in the C10orf88 gene. This relationship illustrates a pathway whereby genetic variation affects certain lipid profiles through regulation of gene expression via APA.
title: Alternative polyadenylation mediates genetic regulation of gene expression

finding: The SNP rs290487 in TCF7L2 was identified as contributing to risks of hypertension, independent of Type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM). This was supported by a study conducted on the Thai elderly population, highlighting the significance of TCF7L2 as it was already established as a susceptibility gene for type 2 DM. Furthermore, a cohort study reinforced this finding by demonstrating that both a parental history of diabetes and the TCF7L2 at-risk variant were linked to a greater incidence of hypertension, after controlling for various cardiometabolic risk factors.
title: Prediction of drug targets for specific diseases leveraging gene perturbation data: A machine learning approach

finding: The study identified strong EBNA2 allele-dependent binding at the ZMIZ1 locus, associated with multiple sclerosis (MS). Additionally, rs1250567 was established as a strong expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for ZMIZ1 in EBV-immortalized lymphoblast cell lines and whole blood, indicating a genetic mechanism influencing ZMIZ1 expression linked to autoimmune predisposition.
title: Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 (EBNA2) extensively rewires the human chromatin landscape at autoimmune risk loci

finding: The SNP rs545425011, located in the DNAJC12 locus, was significantly associated with the microbial composition of the tongue dorsum (p = 1.07 × 10^-8), revealing correlations predominantly with taxa including Leptotrichia A sp000469505 and Prevotella saccharolytica.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The study noted that the tumoral A genotype of the MGMT rs34180180 single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) was associated with shorter survival in patients with aggressive gliomas. This finding indicated a correlation between the genotype and clinical outcomes.
title: Most of transcriptional alterations in glioma result from DNA-methylation independent mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs11101421 was associated with the impact of fibroblast-derived SPARC on the invasiveness of colorectal cancer (CRC) cells. This finding suggested a specific role for the genetic variant in modulating the interaction between stromal cells and tumor aggressiveness in CRC, linking it to the functional outcomes observed in dysplastic cellular neighborhoods within tumor ecosystems.
title: Integrative single cell and spatial transcriptomics of colorectal cancer reveals multicellular functional units that support tumor progression

finding: The SNP rs3740400, associated with an unannotated exon skipping event in the AS3MT gene, co-localized with the schizophrenia GWAS SNP (rs11191419) and was linked to risk allele usage in this context.
title: Genetic effects on brain traits impact cell-type specific gene regulation during neurogenesis

finding: Evidence for cross-disorder GxS interaction was noted for SNP rs7914279 (p=6.4×10^-7), emphasizing its significance in the genomic landscape of these psychiatric conditions.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: This SNP was found in the WDR11-FGFR2 locus, associated with increased body mass index and traditional CAD risk factors such as triglyceride levels and HDL cholesterol. This finding marked it as a novel candidate locus for CAD.
title: Transethnic meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies three new loci and characterizes population-specific differences for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs10883083, associated with the PYROXD2 locus on chromosome 10, showed the strongest association with CSF levels of five inter-correlated metabolites (r^2 > 0.83) including N(epsilon)-Dimethyl-L-lysine. The P-value ranged from 5.03e-181 to 3.58e-214, indicating a robust correlation.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: Identified as an MS-specific deepSNP, rs12768537 was highlighted for its relation to the transcription factors MafK in the K562 cell line. It functioned alongside rs62420820, supporting a role in MS pathophysiology.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: Linked to the Prosaposin gene PSAP, rs11000015 was implicated in influencing gene expression levels across various tissues and associated with MS disease status due to its involvement in transcription factor binding.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The T2D-risk allele (G allele) at rs703972 was associated with significantly lower insulin content in human islets from homozygous carriers compared to noncarriers. In addition, insulin secretion in response to high glucose (16.7 mM) was reduced in T2D-risk allele carriers while no differences were observed at low glucose concentrations.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: The T2D-risk allele (A allele) at rs12571751 was also linked to reduced insulin content in islets from homozygous carriers compared to noncarriers. A reduction in insulin secretion in response to high glucose levels was especially noted in carriers of this allele, paralleling the findings associated with rs703972.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: The T genotype of the MGMT C>T (rs16906252) enhancer SNP was associated with promoter methylation and resulted in longer survival rates for glioblastoma patients. This finding highlighted the importance of this SNP in relation to TMZ resistance, indicating a potential pathway for improved treatment outcomes in glioblastoma.
title: Long-range gene regulation network of the MGMT enhancer in modulating glioma cell sensitivity to temozolomide

finding: Associated with multiple body composition metrics, this SNP is an exon in PLCE1 and relates to fat percentage and overall body mass.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This was identified as the strongest GWAS hit related to the associated mode 45_62, indicating significant genetic underpinnings.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP, an eQTL of INPP5A, was linked to aging and depression, marking it a pivotal genetic variant.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The rs2981579 variant was associated with the transcription start site of FGFR2 during breast cancer analysis. It formed interaction peaks with several distal fragments and co-localized with DNAse I hypersensitive sites and various transcription factor binding sites, indicating its role in FGFR2 gene regulation related to breast cancer.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs4752575 variant was reported to alter FGFR2 expression leading to increased susceptibility to breast cancer, with physical interactions involving a chromatin fragment containing binding sites for FOXA1.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure
